programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Residents in Newcastle who have become prisoners in their own homes, thanks to a neighbour's terrifying behaviour. Plus, north London tenants isolated from their community.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A lot including a fish-and-chip shop, a flat and a storage area in Fareham, Hampshire, plus a semi in Dudley in the West Midlands, and a studio flat in Croydon, south east London.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: A dawn raid in London leads to the arrest of an elusive Portuguese woman wanted for embezzlement. West Yorkshire police track a teenager's attacker all the way to Slovakia.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates bike helmets for sale that fail safety tests, as well as counterfeit pesticides that could be heading for UK farms, and the problem of fake supermarket savings stamps.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts help two teams search for bargains at Staffordshire County Showground. Paul Laidlaw assists a mother-and-daughter pair with expensive tastes, while Mark Stacey joins two cheeky police officers. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott spends some time bouncing around on a vintage exercise device.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi returns from his trip to a harsh reality check, while Daniel accuses Zara of foul play. Karen finds herself in a dangerous situation after misjudging someone's behaviour.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz, in which three friends from Bidford-on-Avon must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a property in rural Cheshire, and also visits the Anderson Boat Lift, which links the River Weaver and the Trent and Mersey Canal. Postponed from Wednesday 22nd March.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves a battered suitcase, a wingback chair and a Formica table top from the recycling centre, and tries to transform them with the help of Daniel Heath and Ray Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper are in Reading, Berkshire, where items including a biscuit barrel shaped like a Scottish curling stone and a silver box with a Jasper stone top.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Preston convinces Michelle to leave Dennis home alone so they can have a romantic evening. But it's clear the pressure is getting to her. Whitney tries to get to the bottom of what's going on with Lauren, and as things grow fraught between the pair, a few home truths are laid bare. Denise's meeting gets off to a bad start although one of the suggestions to help the community seems like a good idea.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern are in Surrey, where a year ago part-time teacher Flo took some time out to look after the couple's children, aged four, five and six - but her love of socialising means she regularly goes into her overdraft. Meanwhile, her petrolhead husband John has an expensive hobby, buying various spare parts and paying for a second garage. How will the couple feel when some of their favourite products are taken away? Plus, a group of campers test different canopies and Avi Shankar reveals how early children can be influenced by advertising.(n)

programme.title: The Red Nose African Convoy
programme.desc: Six celebrities set out on a 700km drive across East Africa to deliver crucial supplies that will help Comic Relief projects continue their life-saving health work. Working in pairs, David Baddiel, Hugh Dennis, Reggie Yates, Michaela Coel, Katy Brand and Russell Kane put their driving skills to the test as they brave the infamous Northern Corridor, considered to be one of the world's most dangerous roads to lead a convoy delivering vital supplies across East Africa. Along the way they visit a maternity unit where supplies are scarce, find out about projects to help those with HIV, deliver bicycles to health workers and distribute 3,000 life-saving mosquito nets.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Bangor, north Wales, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a light-hearted romp through the latest political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright finds out about a Newcastle Housing Association's new system to tackle anti-social behaviour, and meets a tenant who has been evicted and rehoused on the same day.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts are joined by former footballer Dion Dublin to explore properties about to be auctioned. They visit a former miner's cottage in Aberaman, south Wales, plus semi-detached properties in Adderley Green, Stoke and Streatham, south London. They then speak to the buyers about their plans, and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers seek a man accused of a murder in Poland, while detectives in West Yorkshire try to find a man accused of stealing and killing pigs in Hungary.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates fraudulent gas meter readings, and the damaging consequences this can have for members of the public. Plus, the takeaway pizzas that have been made with fake cheese and how some dodgy dealers are making a hit with imitation film posters.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles invites two teams to seek out bargain buys at the East of England Showground in Peterborough. Experts Charles Hanson and Tim Weeks are on hand to assist.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma's desperation for company leads to her making the wrong move with the wrong person. Elsewhere, Mrs Tembe makes a big decision about her relationship with JJ.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz, in which two brothers from Glasgow must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a composer with a budget of £450,000 escape suburbia and find a home in the Shropshire countryside. Away from the house-hunt, the presenter visits a stately home.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upcycling expert Sarah Moore tasks carpenter Norman Wilkinson with reimagining an old wall cabinet, while she takes on the challenge of restyling a fashion mannequin.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Bletchley Park, Buckinghamshire, Paul Martin and the experts celebrate the programme's 1,000th edition by taking a fond look back at their favourite moments and finds.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2017
programme.desc: East London's O2 stages the centrepiece of Comic Relief as Lenny Henry, Jonathan Ross, Sally Phillips, Rob Beckett, Romesh Ranganathan, Warwick Davis and Miranda Hart front a night of fundraising fun and games. French and Saunders, Reeves and Mortimer, Matt Berry and Catherine Tate all perform, while Johnny Vegas and Joe Lycett take over the cooking and serving duties at a local pizza restaurant - what could possibly go wrong? James Corden presents an exclusive Car Pool Karaoke from LA with Take That, and the cast of Love Actually fast forward 13 years into `Red Nose Day Actually'. There are also exclusive treats from Mrs Brown, Alan Partridge, Peter Kay and David Walliams, live music by Ed Sheeran, Rag 'N' Bone Man and Emeli Sande, and reports from an array of celebrities on the work being carried out to aid disadvantaged people across the UK and Africa. To donate call 03457 910910. Continues on BBC Two and returns to BBC One at 10.35pm.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2017
programme.sub-title: Red Nose Day: Graham Norton's Big Chat Live.
programme.desc: The comedian supersizes his chat show with a ludicrously long sofa to be filled with more star guests than ever before. Among those joining him is the Kurupt FM crew with the world premiere of its much-anticipated musical collaboration with Ed Sheeran.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team take a look at the finer things in life as they go behind the scenes at Longleat House in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers search for a Hungarian man convicted of burglaries in West Yorkshire, while a drugs courier is arrested by Dutch police after more than a decade on the run.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items bound for the skip in Walsall, featuring a Lloyd Loom-style laundry basket, a reclining chair and an oak writing bureau.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don kicks off the gardening year from Longmeadow, sharing his tips for pruning, planting up pots for spring colour and sharing his plans for the coming year. At the National Trust's Packwood House in Warwickshire, the herbaceous borders come under Adam Frost's scrutiny as he finds out how they have been planted for maximum colour and impact. Over the course of this 50th series, Carol Klein will be sharing some of her heroes of gardening. She begins with plantswoman, garden designer and author Beth Chatto.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey across Ireland, starting in the port of Wexford, where he takes to the seas in a 100-year-old lifeboat and discovers a hero of the American navy.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman hosts the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Building Dream Homes
programme.desc: As Bobby Halliday's development in Stirlingshire nears completion, one client's obsession with cars forces a complete redesign of the house he is moving into. Near Edinburgh, architects Christopher Dinnis and Carolyn Whiteford work with a family to gain planning permission to convert an old silversmith's in the heart of a conservation village into a family home.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Pam Ayres to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with the poet's selection including one of the scariest series ever broadcast on British TV.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Singer Annie Lennox researches the female ancestry of her family. As the Eurythmics star and campaigner visits Aberdeen, where she was born, the coastal town of Banff and a Highland estate, she uncovers dark tales of tangled relationships, illegitimacy and poverty, and discovers the humiliations her unmarried great-great-grandmother suffered before the Kirk.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Small-animal vet Adam decides that his Shetland pony Hector should have an operation to make him less aggressive, and Steve helps a border collie with a womb infection. Meanwhile in Teesdale, farm vet Graham discovers a cow is having difficulty giving birth to twins.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: Following his visit to the Great Barrier Reef in 1957, naturalist and broadcaster David Attenborough returns and uses the latest filming techniques to unlock the secrets of the natural wonder.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Richard Madley head to Peterborough where they help two teams, which include a community cook and a playground equipment, designer search for bargains. Paul Laidlaw guest presents.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prove that home-made can beat shop-bought when they prepare gravlax, jam doughnuts and their own corned beef.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an `avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents the final, in which the last three potters have to make a pair of identical, fully functioning light features from porcelain, the delicate clay that is the trickiest to work with. But that's not all. In the spot test, they are challenged to sculpt the torso of a special guest, ice dancer Sylvian Longchambon, and in the throw down they must make as many Japanese lanterns as they can in 10 minutes. But as this is the final, they have to do it the authentic Japanese way, with the wheel turning clockwise - the opposite of what they are used to. After all their hard work, who will be judged the winner? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Spies infiltrate the Cumbraland army, leaving Uhtred to rely on his troops to protect him from a perilous attack. While he rides out as the dead horseman once again, Kjartan's thirst for revenge grows ever stronger. Hild goes on a journey of self-discovery as she considers exchanging her life as a nun for that of a warrior, and Guthred's efforts to emulate Alfred's peace-making tactics backfires when his indecision and lack of ruthlessness weakens the Saxons' position. Meanwhile, when Uhtred's attraction for Gisela reaches new heights, his enemies close in and he suffers a grave betrayal.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Elis James and Sara Pascoe join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at events from September 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Rory Reid and Sabine Schmitz go in search of the latest supercars at Germany's Nurburgring circuit, while Matt LeBlanc test drives the Aston Martin DB11, but finds Chris Harris and his Mercedes causing no end of trouble. Tamsin Greig takes to the Top Gear Test Track as this week's Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear: Extra Gear
programme.desc: George Lewis and Rory Reid bond over their love of the Fiesta, and Sabine Schmitz talks about the Gold GTi Clubsport. Plus, how to film a DB11 at speed down the runway at Dunsfold.(n)

programme.title: The Real Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Half of the group head off to the hill stations of the Nilgiri mountains, but the drive involves a treacherous climb that has them on the edge of their seats. Dennis and Paul complete the journey by steam train, passing a station full of monkeys before arriving in Ooty, a town that allows Dennis to fulfil a lifelong dream, as he gets to play a game on the very first snooker table. Sheila, Amanda and Lionel attend a Hindu ancestor ceremony held to remember departed loved ones and reflect on death itself and the fact that they have lost many famous friends over the last year. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Beti and David: Lost for Words
programme.desc: Documentary following the experiences of broadcaster Beti George as she cares for her partner David Parry-Jones, who has Alzheimer's. The film reveals the challenges and frustrations faced by thousands of people across Wales, and questions the way society supports dementia carers.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Boxes and the wonderful, often valuable secrets they hold form the backbone of this show, with presenter Paul Martin discussing snuff boxes with James Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: A dawn raid in London leads to the arrest of an elusive Portuguese woman wanted for embezzlement. West Yorkshire police track a teenager's attacker all the way to Slovakia.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves a battered suitcase, a wingback chair and a Formica table top from the recycling centre, and tries to transform them with the help of Daniel Heath and Ray Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter champions the UK's most inspirational rural entrepreneurs, here following six Pembrokeshire businesses through key events of their seasonal year. Kate Humble meets a seaweed collector who left an office job in Swindon for a life working on the beach, and is now running a successful business selling Welsh seaweed products to a global market. Meanwhile, Geetie Singh-Watson is with rookie chocolatiers who are trying to take on the big boys from an old cow shed in west Wales.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Building Dream Homes
programme.desc: Edinburgh-based architect David Blaikie grapples with a modern extension that will double the size of an old railway station. Money is tight so the owner and his friends take on the demolition of part of the house to cut costs, but their gung-ho attitude leads to costly accidents. In the New Forest, Wendy Perring designs a mobile home the same size as an average Victorian semi.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Comedian Stephen K Amos joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that shaped him into one of Britain's funniest men. From the singing pig pop stars Pinky and Perky, to the terrifying Tales of the Unexpected by way of entertainer Danny la Rue, Stephen's early television influences are wide and varied, but why does he believe he owes his entire career to TV adverts for vacuum cleaners?.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Alex Kingston researches her family tree, investigating the military life of her great-grandfather William Keevil, whose career as a photographer led to him being given a key responsibility in the First World War before his death at the Battle of Passchendaele. She also explores rumours of Jewish ancestry, going back several generations, and hears how her mother's widowed great-great-great-grandmother embarked on an unconventional enterprise to avoid sliding into poverty.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Farm vet Richard visits a long-standing client, where his work involves anything from de-horning a cow to trimming an overgrown hoof, rounded off with tea and home-made scones. Meanwhile, Megan treats a seriously ill Yorkshire terrier at the Small Animal Hospital in Fife, and there is news for an unsuspecting cat owner when vet Adam makes a surprise discovery. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Meet the big birds, a feathered family who've never flown a day in their lives. From ostriches to kiwis, these bizarre birds appear to be nature's greatest novelty act. How they came to be and how they continue to survive is a fascinating tale that has long captivated David Attenborough. In this programme, he tells a story of dedicated dads, enormous eggs and a serious need for speed. And far from being the court jesters of the animal world, these flightless curiosities once nearly ruled the planet.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper aid two teams as they scour an antiques fair at Epsom Racecourse, Surrey, in a bid to pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Presenter Natasha Raskin observes their progress and later witnesses some interesting results at the auction with Jonathan Pratt.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate food from Northumberland, including local seafood, a traditional lamb recipe and a new way of serving Si's favourite ice-cream. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Europe behind to take in the sights, smells and tastes of North Africa as he travels from the Mediterranean port of Tangier to the Berber city of Marrakech. At Asilah, the political commentator lends a hand with the construction of Morocco's new £3billion high-speed railway line to Casablanca, where he calls in to the most famous gin joint in the world.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden, when he plants bare root trees and gives advice on climbers that will happily grow on east-facing walls. Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone, while Frances Tophill meets the enthusiastic gardeners of Barbados who fill their gardens with colour, foliage and world class flowers. As part of the programmes 50th Anniversary, Flo Headlam reveals the plant she thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the first semi-final, in which two teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Preion, Detive, Inenza and Eabeth.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ireland: The Edge of the World
programme.desc: Part two of two. Colin Stafford-Johnson heads north from Clew Bay for Donegal - golden eagle country - before reaching the island's northern tip and turning east along the coast of Northern Ireland. Along the way he observes the whooper swans that fly in every autumn to escape the Arctic winter and the elusive pine marten, an animal resident in the area since the last Ice Age. Basking sharks, bats and salmon are among the other creatures Colin comes across as he seeks out the remotest corners of Ireland's wild west.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2017
programme.sub-title: Red Nose Day: Greg Davies' Hot Tub Half-Hour.
programme.desc: The comedian is joined in his tub by some very special guests, including the cast of iconic sketch show Smack the Pony, who have reassembled after 13 years. Diane Morgan aka Philomena Cunk features in a Moment of Wonder, grilling Richard Curtis about Comic Relief. There's an exclusive sketch from the hottest new comedy stars, while Frankie Boyle and Rebecca Front star in a sketch following a group addicted to heckling at comedy clubs. Plus, Making Love Actually offers an expose about the filming of the hit movie's sequel. Red Nose Day continues on BBC One.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the third heat. Eight teams battle it out to win a single place in the grand final, pitting robots Foxic, Expulsion, Heavy Metal, MR Speed Squared, Thor, Tauron, Chimera 2 and Concussion against each other in the arena. The show begins with two group battles, followed by a head-to-head between the two overall winners.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present music from June 8, featuring Twisted Sister, the Imposter - aka Elvis Costello - Shakatak, Big Country and the Police.(n)

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle examines the often contradictory character of the Tudor monarch. Henry ordered the killing of writers and the demolition of ancient monasteries during his reign, yet was a cultured man who brought the Renaissance to England with a major building programme, tapestry collection and genuine love of the arts.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Age of Steam Railways
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the visionaries who rescued some of the narrow gauge railways that once served Britain's key industries, including its mines, quarries, factories and docks. Home movies reveal how volunteers set to work to bring the lines and steam engines back to life after they disappeared in the years following the Second World War. Narrated by Jenny Agutter.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Lords
programme.desc: Documentary filmed over a year following life at the House of Lords, one of Britain's oldest, most idiosyncratic and most important institutions, going behind the scenes during a turbulent 12 months that has seen dramatic changes in the political landscape and the Lords battling it out with the Government. The first edition introduces the larger-than-life characters that populate the House, including new people's peers, hereditaries and political grandees, as they try to change legislation and follow their personal passions.(n)

programme.title: Tales from the Royal Bedchamber
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley examines the changing fortunes of the British monarchy by touring a selection of bedrooms once occupied by members of the royal family. Along the way, she reveals the extent of the nation's age-old obsession with royal babies, weddings and successions.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores the golden age of piracy during the early 18th century, when Captain Kidd, Blackbeard, Calico Jack and others were in operation on the high seas. He charts the devastating impact they had during an era of colonial expansion and how they became the most wanted outlaws in the world by plundering the vast network of maritime trade, they became the most wanted outlaws in the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present music from June 8, featuring Twisted Sister, Ultravox, H2O, the Imposter - aka Elvis Costello - Shakatak, Big Country and the Police.(n)

programme.title: Country at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of BBC session performances by country artists from the past four decades, including Tammy Wynette, Emmylou Harris, Johnny Cash, Dolly Parton, Charley Pride, Kris Kristofferson, Garth Brooks, Willie Nelson, Alison Krauss, Taylor Swift, kd lang and Billie Jo Spears.(n)

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle examines the often contradictory character of the Tudor monarch. Henry ordered the killing of writers and the demolition of ancient monasteries during his reign, yet was a cultured man who brought the Renaissance to England with a major building programme, tapestry collection and genuine love of the arts.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell introduce an edition from June 23, featuring performances by Freeez, Rod Stewart, Elton John, Shakatak, Mike Oldfield, H20 and the Police. Plus, John Peel discusses the European charts.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: New series. Anita Rani hosts this contest showcasing the very best British dance talent aged between 16 and 21. This edition focuses on the street dance category, featuring Harry Barnes, Tom Hughes Lloyd, Jodelle Douglas, Kate Morris and Darren Hamilton. Judging them are choreographer and founder of the dance company that bears her name Shobana Jeyasingh, founder and artistic director of Avant Garde Dance Company Tony Adigun, and house and hip-hop dancer and choreographer Clara Bajado. The categories to follow are ballet, contemporary and South Asian, and the contest culminates in a grand final to be staged at Sadler's Wells.(n)

programme.title: Chuck Berry in Concert
programme.desc: The legendary rock 'n' roll singer performs at the BBC Television Theatre in 1972, featuring hits Johnny B Goode, Nadine and Roll Over Beethoven, as well as an innuendo-laden rendition of My Ding-a-Ling.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll America
programme.desc: Documentary examining the most important era in the history of popular music - the birth of rock 'n' roll. The opening programme focuses on the origins of the sound in 1950s America when the rhythm-driven mix of blues, boogie woogie and vocal harmony was nurtured by small independent record labels and championed by young music pioneers such as Fats Domino and Little Richard. This episode also looks at the start of Elvis Presley's career in Memphis and examines the impact the film industry had on the rock movement. Contributors include Tom Jones, Jerry Lee Lewis and Don Everly.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll America
programme.desc: The mid-1950s saw Elvis Presley made his TV debut with Heartbreak Hotel, following it with a gyrating version of Hound Dog that outraged the conservative media. A `cleaned-up' artist was required, and Christian family man Pat Boone sated that need. While Jerry Lee Lewis caused upset with Whole Lotta Shakin and the Everlys shocked with Wake Up Little Susie, bespectacled geek Buddy Holly calmed things down with his school friends the Crickets. Contributors include Jerry Lee Lewis, Don Everly and Tom Jones.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team joins forces with military investigators to ascertain whether terrorists were responsible for an explosion at a golf course in which a marine colonel was killed. As inquiries proceed, McGee has to use his computer skills to break into secret government files to ensure the murderers are apprehended. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former marine falls to his death from a hotel balcony, and investigations quickly lead to the discovery of another body. As Gibbs and the team dig deeper, they uncover evidence that points to the activities of a vice ring trafficking young girls. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan is accused of murdering his accountant after he is discovered leaning over the dead body. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke, Scott Baio and Victoria Rowell.(n)

programme.desc: An outlaw falls in love with a widow, but realises her husband was a man he killed in a gunfight.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Joe volunteers to help the sheriff take an outlaw to jail, but is left to do the task alone when the prisoner kills the lawman.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance insists on taking charge of an investigation into the fatal shooting of a boxer - but antagonises Gibbs in the process, and finds his own past coming under scrutiny as the case unfolds. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing).(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: The IMF team attempt to recover $1million in gold bullion intended for the underground in an Eastern bloc country. Cult action adventure, starring Peter Graves and Martin Landau.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant is found dead in the Pentagon's custodial closet, and surveillance footage indicates she was killed by a co-worker. However, Ziva and the team discover her supposed assailant actually died of a heart attack days before the crime was committed. Meanwhile, suspicions are raised regarding the eyeball left in Tony's drink, and the investigators' attention is fixed on the port-to-port murderer, who appears to still be at large.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 205. A children's dance company helmed by ruthless sisters, a seafood chef from Tennessee, an Oregon winemaker and a marketer of men's accessories try to bait the sharks. Also: an update on a Season 1 entrepreneur who put out a DVD collection called "Classroom Jams."(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 302. Pitches include a watch that its developer says can enhance health; a gourmet-pretzel business; and furniture that can be assembled without tools. Also: a pitch from a California man for a "small" idea; an update on Season 2's Original Man Candle(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 529. Dallas entrepreneurs pitch their smart lightbulb; a father-and-son team from Las Vegas demonstrate a high-tech replacement for a cork; parents from Washington, D.C., want money for their subscription-based children's book business; and a Sarasota, Fla., woman has a fort-building kit for kids that costs $199. Also: a follow-up on the company Breathometer, which was invested in by five of the Sharks(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 603. Two men try to sell the Sharks on their stuffed animals for the bathtub; a dog lover from Los Angeles shows off a wearable pet carrier; and ninja entrepreneurs demonstrate a darts-like card game. Also: a follow-up on a custom bike company based in Dallas, which was invested in by Mark and Barbara during Season 3(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 711. The Sharks try out a new recreational sport; consider investing in a fashion brand that offers wearers the opportunity to do good while looking good; snack on a traditional Brazilian staple; and listen to a pitch concerning missing socks. Also: an update on Mensch on a Bench from Season 6(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Dr Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie reminisces about meeting Doug, recalling how she was originally paired off with Richie, while he was with her friend Lynn. Donny Osmond guest stars, with Kevin James and Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie make new friends, but a scheduling error means they have to choose between going out with some old pals or their new acquaintances.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: After being bombarded with subtle hints, Carrie throws a surprise party to celebrate Arthur's 75th birthday, roping in a reluctant Doug to take the old man out for the day. However, when the pair visit Arthur's favourite restaurant for lunch, he slopes off.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray reluctantly agrees to do charity work at a hospital, but proves so popular with the patients that he starts spending more time with them than at home - much to wife Debra's dismay. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy's mother and father turn up unexpectedly, intending to take their daughter back home with them. They are less than happy to find Ray there, let alone his parents, and the atmosphere is tense as the families take an instant dislike to each other.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Ann Who Came to Dinner.
programme.desc: Maris is released on bail and placed under house arrest, only to embroil an unwitting Niles in a madcap scheme to flee the country. Meanwhile, Frasier is forced to take care of Roz's insurance agent Ann. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Julia Sweeney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Cranes take a trip to the mountains for a holiday away from the city, but Frasier, Niles and Daphne are plagued by nightmares during the overnight journey. Martin also has a strange dream, but unlike the rest of the family, continues to sleep soundly.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef revisits two restaurants, Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea, to find out whether the owners took his advice on how to raise standards. Plus, an update on Finn McCool's.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller and rookie vet Riaz get a huge shock when treating two chipmunks, while a much-loved family cat may have cancer, but only a high-risk intervention can say for certain.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Southport estate agent Gill and her friend Sue look round properties in Alicante, while in Almeria, Chris and Carol are also looking to make a permanent move to the sun.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete in East Sussex. The food includes burgers followed by jelly, and a traditional Ghanaian menu, leaving the third pair confident they have it in the bag.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is feeling neglected by Homer, and the timing couldn't be worse as their 10th wedding anniversary is fast approaching. Little does she know her husband is planning a grand romantic gesture inspired by a special moment from their first year of marriage. But wires get crossed when the miffed housewife stumbles upon a dodgy website for couples bored of their partners, and she ends up chatting to the too-good-to-be-true Ben (voiced by Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane).(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Leela becomes more anxious about her stalker and DS Armstrong does not dispel her fears. Elsewhere, it is the relaunch day at The Dog, and Mac has to make a speech, and Amy is confused by reminders of the wedding she thought she'd cancelled.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay visit some of the UK's most successful restorations of historic buildings, all of which have been placed on the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' long list for their Restoration of the Year award. At the end of the programme, Kevin and Anna are joined by historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr and architectural historian Jonathan Foyle to decide which buildings should make the final shortlist. First up are a watermill brought back to life in Cambridgeshire, a seaside villa in Lyme Regis, a Georgian innovation in Northumberland, and a rescued castle in Ceredigion.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Documentary providing access to the community of Rockland Ranch in the middle of the Utah desert, where 14 Mormon families have made a home for themselves. Half the men here are polygamists, including father-of-16 Enoch Foster. He is one of the most influential men in the community and has two wives, who adore him and each other. But their family is set to expand again, with baby number 17 on the way - and Enoch is also courting a third wife, 25-year-old nanny Lydia.(n)

programme.title: Syria's Disappeared: The Case Against Assad
programme.desc: Documentary investigating how tens of thousands of men, women and children have been disappeared by the Assad regime into a network of clandestine detention centres. Using the testimonies of three survivors and evidence smuggled out of Syria, the film follows victims, family members and international war crimes investigators as they campaign for the release of the disappeared and fight to bring the perpetrators to justice.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Antonio is rushed to A&E after a motorcycle accident leaves him with a severe fracture to his leg and the medical team are concerned about a potential arterial bleed. Meanwhile, doctors investigate the damage to the chest and lungs of 40-year-old Karen, who fell off her horse, which then trampled on her, while leukaemia patient Hayley, 29, comes to St George's with wife Emma after suffering an infection and low immune system.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: A return visit to a Sheffield massage parlour, run by a mother and daughter, which sees business booming for owner Kath, who harbours plans to open a second establishment. However, new premises in the city are thin on the ground, and Kath has daily problems to contend with, such as damp in the gentleman's lounge and a customer with a custard fetish.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: London is home to more billionaires than any other city on the planet and they use a private network of luxury food suppliers. This two-part documentary follows the companies who cater to them, with the opening episode examining how businesses must adapt and fight harder than ever before to win a foothold in this lucrative new market.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel and his team face an emergency when a black Labrador is rushed in after being hit by a car. The pioneering vets also treat a cocker spaniel with a bulging disc in its spine and a basset hound that needs its leg straightening. But the dog is also overweight, so the professor insists it be put on a diet.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton is in Stirlingshire, helping Morag and Heiko Buxel with their continental kit-build home, which they expect will take just six weeks to erect.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits Marsden, West Yorkshire, to help Malcolm and Muriel, whose house has been on the market for three years. Phil urges the couple to modernise their tired home so they can fulfil their dream of downsizing to a more manageable bungalow.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Polish-born carer Sylwia hosts the fourth party of the competition in Boston, Lincolnshire, and hopes her European menu will charm her guests. However, the growing friction between diners Annika and Carolyn threatens to spoil the evening, and the host's chances of winning the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Deacon try their luck on the gaming tables in Atlantic City, telling Carrie a white lie to ensure there is no trouble at home - but their night proves far from profitable. Kevin James and Victor Williams star.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug reveals his benevolent side when he decides to become a mentor to an underprivileged child, but is disappointed with the boy assigned to him. Meanwhile, Carrie has to explain to a partner in her law firm why she declared her love for him over the phone. Kevin James and Leah Remini star.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug is duped by his neighbour into buying a water filtration device. He is drawn deeper into trouble when he signs up to be a licensed seller and needs to find 10 more salesmen to follow in his footsteps to recoup his investment. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy puts Robert in charge of writing invitations to their forthcoming wedding, but he tries to evade responsibility by seeking advice from Ray and Frank. They tell him his best bet is to make an appalling mess of the job so she will have to do it all herself. With Brad Garrett and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra is too ill to take Ally to a pyjama party, so Ray reluctantly agrees to do the honours. Unfortunately it means coming face to face with Peggy, an old enemy who physically assaulted him during a charity event.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles buys an expensive sweater, despite promising Daphne he would start saving for their child's college fund, and Frasier agrees to get Roz and Alice tickets to see a show by his ex-wife, which only serves to fan the embers of lust. Laurie Metcalf guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin suffers a mild heart attack, but tries to keep it from Ronee - to the dismay of Frasier and Niles, who feel it would be unfair of him to hide such serious news. Eventually worn down by their persistence, he decides to confide in her - leading to a conversation that ends in an unexpected way.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to family-owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller and his team deal with an exotic dog with a tricky past, a bulldog in need of a new home and some wild kittens with worms.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Dr Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Special needs teacher Kerry Smith seeks a holiday home in southern Spain, but her limited budget forces her to consider properties more inland than she would have wished.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their `taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer comes up with the bright idea of making money by selling used grease, and ropes Bart in to help, while Lisa tries to join a popular new classmate's social clique. Featuring the guest voice of Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Marnie convinces Mac to slow down and let Ellie run the pub, and Amy doesn't believe that Ryan left a voicemail for her, unaware that Ste deleted it. Ryan is desperate to get the kids to understand, but will Ste help?.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Marcel Theroux explores the resurgent Russian Orthodox Church, which is at the forefront of a new movement combining religion and nationalism in its home nation. Until the fall of the Soviet Union, the Church had been persecuted by the communists, but has now forged close ties with President Vladimir Putin. Theroux meets Alexander Dugin, referred to as `Putin's brain', whose ideas have cropped up in the president's speeches, and Fr Ioann Osyak, patriarch of a family whose members are becoming national celebrities and symbols of today's Russia - religious, conservative and deeply patriotic.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Jan Fursier has discovered in one of her father Reg's diaries an illustrated guide to building a 1930s caravan, drawn up while he was being held in a Japanese prisoner of war camp. George Clarke and Will Hardie attempt to bring the caravan to life, leading to an emotional reunion in the same Welsh national park where Reg took the family on holidays once the Second World War was over.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedian Sandi Toksvig and singer-songwriter James Blunt for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The hosts make use of the £isitok twitter handle, where viewers tweet in edgy current affairs questions that more fearful shows might duck.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fairy-tale fan Kathleen still hasn't met her Prince Charming, but at first glance, international fashion model Sam doesn't disappoint. Will she be impressed with his stories of saving cats from burning buildings?.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy

programme.desc: Marshall looks after the pups when they get ill, while Rubble and Ryder search for Farmer Al's runaway pigs, Marshall.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Sian Morris tries to allay the fears of patients overcome by worry and anxiety, including gym-goer Cherie, who is suffering from heart palpitations, and octogenarian couple Ken and Joan, who have concerns about their future. There is one patient, however, that she cannot reassure completely. Jake is experiencing symptoms including numbness, twitching in his limbs, and pins and needles in his extremities, and the GP fears this could indicate a serious neurological condition.(n)

programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Manchester, where a landlord is owed £8,000 in rent arrears and has already called for police back-up. As tempers rise, the pair must find a way to handle a situation that is spiralling dangerously out of control. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase £3,000 owed to a firm of letting agents, before tracking a debtor who was accidentally over-paid for a job. Plus, Stewart and Iain face an eviction that is set to test their patience.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: NCIS: Kill List Part 4: The Enemy Within.
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Killer Obsession
programme.desc: Premiere. A National Guard solder returns from the frontline in Iraq and struggles to return to a normal life. To make matters worse, she finds herself blamed for a friendly fire incident in which two Americans were killed - and then she becomes the target of an obsessed fellow soldier seeking revenge for their deaths. Thriller, starring Roxanne McGee.(n)

programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie faces the consequences of his betrayal, Jack wonders whether to `step up' for the sake of Paige and his child, while Mark keeps a tight guard over Sonya.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan Brigginshaw is kept on his toes when a suspect does a runner, a routine vehicle check turns into a drug bust for Suzie Ranyard, and Barry Peach has his hands full when a group of Scottish revellers clash with bouncers in Skegness. Elsewhere, Jim Woolerton and Jason Baxter catch out a rookie rider who is breaking the law.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits and 40 Grand in Debt.
programme.desc: New series. Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, focusing on some who have found themselves in serious debt.(n)

programme.title: The Last Days of George Michael
programme.desc: Documentary charting the days leading up to the shocking death of singer George Michael on Christmas Day 2016, leading to an outpouring of grief from friends and fans alike.(n)

programme.title: Extraordinary People
programme.sub-title: The Snake Skin Woman: Extraordinary People.
programme.desc: The return of the documentary telling remarkable tales of human experience from around the world, beginning with a woman who lives with a rare skin condition. Nusrit `Nelly' Shaheen from Coventry is the oldest known survivor of Harlequin Ichthyosis, which causes the skin to grow 10 times faster than normal. As a result, her skin cracks and appears scaly, and she spends four hours every day scrubbing off layers of dead skin. The film follows Nelly as she goes about her daily routines and as she meets others sufferers, as well as her desperate search for treatment to alleviate her symptoms.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The disappearance of Shannon Matthews was a story that gripped and then appalled Britain. Nine years on, this documentary examines her kidnapping and why people close to the case believe the police should reopen their investigation. Featuring the insight of some of those closest to the case, the programme charts the impact on an innocent girl caught in the lies and greed of those who were supposed to be caring for her.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: The actor and history buff negotiates northern England's Coast to Coast route, beginning in the Cumbrian village of St Bees, which though small boasts a sizable church. While travelling through the Lake District, Tony discovers the upper crust origins of the Scotch egg, then at the region's most westerly lake, meets a farmer taking a pioneering approach to protect the natural environment. After a spell in the mountains flanking the Honister Pass, Tony digs into the history of slate extraction, before heading to England's most remote youth hostel, nestled deep in the fells.(n)

programme.title: Tribal Teens
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old nightclub dancer Courtney and 17-year-old ultra-vain Charlie face up to life on the frozen Mongolian plains as they spend a week with a family of hardy Kazakhs in a communal tent. The pair consume the local cuisine - including horse meat - and contend with only the most basic sanitation. They also learn to appreciate that for the Kazakh tribe, even getting water involves a major expedition to a frozen river to hack out blocks of ice.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Anne Maurice offers advice to the owner of a Brixton flat, on the market for £235,000, to make it more attractive to prospective buyers.(n)

programme.title: HouseBusters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis meets a homeowner who feels trapped in her property, and has seen various attempts to sell it fall through. She receives advice from a feng shui expert, who claims she is too fixated on the past, a `home healer', who diagnoses low energy levels in the property, and a mystic who announces that the tree outside her bedroom window has to go.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: Alba wants to get her sea sprite badge and sets off to explore an island. However, Hopper hears terrible noises and thinks there could be a monster nearby.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Hatsie is too proud to ask for help when she gets stranded out at sea.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Tidy Up.

programme.desc: Cap'n Turbot and his cousin Francois go whale-watching in Adventure Bay, but when the Flounder hits a rock and starts to sink, the pups race to the rescue.(n)

programme.desc: One of the knights tries a magic spell and accidentally shrinks himself, but with the Queen in hiding, Noddy has to persuade her to return to the little soldier to the right size.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Chicken of the Sea.
programme.desc: Ryder and the puppies meet a giant sea slug when they set out to retrieve Cap'n Turbot's sunken diving bell.(n)

programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy use a magic wand to turn the kingdom's residents into rabbits, frogs and birds.(n)

programme.desc: The piglet and her friends learn how to count by playing games at Madame Gazelle's school.(n)

programme.desc: The little girl meets Francois, a flamingo who will not join in the Flamingo Flamenco. She calls in Monty the Meerkat, who tries to teach the reluctant flamingo some cool moves.(n)

programme.desc: Bryan's ego gets in the way of his playing with the other boats, so Toot helps him to say sorry and join in with the boats' fun again.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.desc: Dr Eleanor Beecraft has a consultation with Iain, who has been a smoker for most of his life and has developed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Meanwhile, Dr Claire Taylor meets Laura, a young woman suffering from shortness of breath. The GP diagnoses a serious chest infection and advises her to stay in bed, but her patient is desperate to attend a birthday party in Birmingham the following evening.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Lancashire for an eviction that proves to be the most confrontational case they have ever faced. In Surrey, Brian and Del chase over £2,000 owed by a single mother for an unpaid childcare bill, before trying to recover £12,000 of debt on credit cards. Meanwhile, Stewart and Iain's patience is tested to the limit during another eviction in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori has to make a decision when she finds Nate and Riley arguing at the hospital, Justin is unhappy to learn Riley is in town and Olivia and Mason take their relationship further.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Elly is happy for Xanthe to see another tutor - until she discovers that Finn will replace her. Paige considers Jack's proposition, while Aaron finds a new lead for David.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: NCIS: Kill List Part 5: Cabin Fever.
programme.desc: The team suspects Gibbs's arch-nemesis is behind an explosion at a summit on global terror. Meanwhile, a grief-stricken Fornell struggles to deal with the fatal shooting of his ex-wife. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: Love You to Death
programme.desc: Premiere. An attorney freezes in court, and her mistake allows a murderer go free. Ordered to take a sabbatical, Yasmine returns to her home town, ostensibly to spend time with her daughter and sister, but secretly planning to rebuild the case. However, such intentions are scuppered when the man she inadvertently set free shows up vowing retribution. Thriller, starring Bree Williamson and Emilija Baranac.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Elly is happy for Xanthe to see another tutor - until she discovers that Finn will replace her. Paige considers Jack's proposition, while Aaron finds a new lead for David.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori has to make a decision when she finds Nate and Riley arguing at the hospital, Justin is unhappy to learn Riley is in town and Olivia and Mason take their relationship further.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Britain's Got Talent 2014 finalists the Addict Initiative help Jon Bentley test the latest wireless earbuds in an extreme dance routine. Georgie Barrat continues to help struggling football team Monkey Tree FC using technology to focus on potential diet and nutrition wins, while Ortis Deley hears about quantum computers which it's suggested will be millions, billions, or even trillions of times faster than current technology.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: In the upland hills of the Lake District's Borrowdale valley, the presenter meets one of the last tenant sheep farmers, who is facing challenging times but is determined to keep working his farm. The actor and history buff also receives an exclusive tour of the only inhabited island on Derwentwater, learns how to cook chutney at Grasmere, gets a rare sighting of a red squirrel, and boards a tourist boat at Ullswater to discover the integral part they played in the industrial heritage of the area.(n)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A veteran American sergeant leads a tank crew on one final dangerous mission in the last months of the Second World War. The assignment takes the soldiers behind enemy lines and into battle with overwhelming enemy forces, while the presence of an inexperienced new recruit in the team raises tension. Drama, starring Brad Pitt and Shia LaBeouf. Edited for language.(n)

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: During the Second World War, German businessman Oskar Schindler strives to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Josh Hartnett star in a WWII blockbuster from the director of Transformers. A US pilot travels to Britain to fight in the war just before the Japanese attack(n)

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: In this action epic set during the Han dynasty, a Chinese commander joins forces with a Roman general to protect China's sovereignty from a power-hungry villain(n)

programme.title: According to Spencer
programme.desc: A young man moves to Los Angeles to make something of himself -- but finds that such a task might take a little more work than he thought -- in this romantic comedy. According to Spencer stars Jesse Bradford as the titular Spencer, an ad agency mail room clerk just-arrived in L.A. and eager to make his presence felt. Renting a room in a run-down mansion, Spencer crosses paths with shady eccentrics Ezra (David Krumholtz) and Feldy (Adam Goldberg), aspiring porn filmmakers who convince him to make inroads as a commercial director -- with little success. But when Spencer serendipitously meets his childhood sweetheart Melora (Mia Kirshner), who's currently stuck in a go-nowhere relationship with the smarmy Craig (Brad Rowe), things begin to look up(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: A biography of of Scottish playwright JM Barrie, whose relationship with a young widow and her sons inspired the children's classic "Peter Pan"(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Gripping Holocaust biopic with Adrien Brody as a gifted Polish-Jewish musician struggling to survive in the Warsaw ghetto. Brody dropped about 30 pounds to affect the emaciated look of a starving man. Roman Polanski scored Best Director. As a Jewish youngster in 1939 Krakow, Polanski witnessed the Nazi invasion. It's his first film shot in his native Poland since 1962's "Knife in the Water," his feature-film debut(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Pulse-pounding action and a topflight cast drive this exciting adventure from producer Jerry Bruckheimer. Nicolas Cage stars as a modern-day fortune hunter who races to find a treasure hidden by the Founding Fathers. The filmmakers ratchet up the suspense when Cage is tracked by the authorities and an unrelenting nemesis(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Kal Penn and John Cho return in this outrageous sequel. The pot-smoking slacker pals are suspected of being terrorists---and have more irreverent misadventures with Neil Patrick Harris. Rob Corddry, Roger Bart, David Krumholtz, Eddie Kaye Thomas. Written and directed by Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Hellboy isn't about to stand idly by as the planet is purged by a demonic despot, and with a little help from his team at the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence, he may just be able to send our otherworldly overlords packing(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: Inconsolable, a young mother is determined to bring her son back from the dead through an ancient ritual. She travels to a temple and finds a door that serves as a portal between two worlds, but disregards a sacred warning and unleashes evil in the form of her son(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: The rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics(n)

programme.title: The Rose
programme.desc: Ill-fated singer Rose succumbs to the pressures of performing by indulging in drugs and alcohol. Her sweetheart Dyer is the former chauffeur who naively tries to save her from self destruction, while her British manager Rudge is ultimately blamed for not preventing her inevitable fall. The story mirrors any one of a number of popular singers who have fallen victim to the excess of success(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Casanova
programme.desc: A retelling of the legend of the infamous 18th-century Venetian lover. Casanova is ordered to clean up his act and marry a virtuous virgin by the Doge, but opts to pursue her tempestuous sister instead(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: Crime drama with the late, great Robin Williams about a veteran detective who journeys to a small Alaskan town with his partner to investigate the murder of a 17-year-old girl. Dir: Christopher Nolan(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Mimic
programme.desc: A disease carried by common cockroaches is killing Manhattan children. In an effort to stop the epidemic an entomologist, Susan Tyler, creates a mutant breed of insect that secretes a fluid to kill the roaches. This mutant breed was engineered to die after one generation, but three years later Susan finds out that the species has survived and evolved into a large, gruesome monster that can mimic human form(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Action tale adapted from the popular video game in which the eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. The buxom adventurer travels to some exotic locales, where she battles a variety of fantastical creatures with the knowledge that the fate of mankind rests in her hands(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Armed and dangerous action with Arnold Schwarzenegger as the US Marshal assigned to protect a vital government witness from high-powered criminals(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum

programme.title: Pearl Harbor

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: In this action epic set during the Han dynasty, a Chinese commander joins forces with a Roman general to protect China's sovereignty from a power-hungry villain(n)

programme.title: According to Spencer
programme.desc: A young man moves to Los Angeles to make something of himself -- but finds that such a task might take a little more work than he thought -- in this romantic comedy. According to Spencer stars Jesse Bradford as the titular Spencer, an ad agency mail room clerk just-arrived in L.A. and eager to make his presence felt. Renting a room in a run-down mansion, Spencer crosses paths with shady eccentrics Ezra (David Krumholtz) and Feldy (Adam Goldberg), aspiring porn filmmakers who convince him to make inroads as a commercial director -- with little success. But when Spencer serendipitously meets his childhood sweetheart Melora (Mia Kirshner), who's currently stuck in a go-nowhere relationship with the smarmy Craig (Brad Rowe), things begin to look up(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: A biography of of Scottish playwright JM Barrie, whose relationship with a young widow and her sons inspired the children's classic "Peter Pan"(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Gripping Holocaust biopic with Adrien Brody as a gifted Polish-Jewish musician struggling to survive in the Warsaw ghetto. Brody dropped about 30 pounds to affect the emaciated look of a starving man. Roman Polanski scored Best Director. As a Jewish youngster in 1939 Krakow, Polanski witnessed the Nazi invasion. It's his first film shot in his native Poland since 1962's "Knife in the Water," his feature-film debut(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Pulse-pounding action and a topflight cast drive this exciting adventure from producer Jerry Bruckheimer. Nicolas Cage stars as a modern-day fortune hunter who races to find a treasure hidden by the Founding Fathers. The filmmakers ratchet up the suspense when Cage is tracked by the authorities and an unrelenting nemesis(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Kal Penn and John Cho return in this outrageous sequel. The pot-smoking slacker pals are suspected of being terrorists---and have more irreverent misadventures with Neil Patrick Harris. Rob Corddry, Roger Bart, David Krumholtz, Eddie Kaye Thomas. Written and directed by Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg(n)

programme.title: Everest

programme.title: Pale Rider

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: Inconsolable, a young mother is determined to bring her son back from the dead through an ancient ritual. She travels to a temple and finds a door that serves as a portal between two worlds, but disregards a sacred warning and unleashes evil in the form of her son(n)

programme.title: Constantine

programme.title: Legend
