programme.title: The Rose
programme.desc: Ill-fated singer Rose succumbs to the pressures of performing by indulging in drugs and alcohol. Her sweetheart Dyer is the former chauffeur who naively tries to save her from self destruction, while her British manager Rudge is ultimately blamed for not preventing her inevitable fall. The story mirrors any one of a number of popular singers who have fallen victim to the excess of success(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Casanova

programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.desc: A disease carried by common cockroaches is killing Manhattan children. In an effort to stop the epidemic an entomologist, Susan Tyler, creates a mutant breed of insect that secretes a fluid to kill the roaches. programme.desc: A team of medics fights tropical diseases, beginning with a girl who finds a lump next to her elbow, and a woman who hopes the treatment for malaria will not harm her unborn baby.(n)

programme.title: Bugs, Bites and Parasites: Tropical Diseases Uncovered
programme.desc: David treats a deadly snake bite and discovers a parasitic worm in a patient. Plus, why some parasites lay eggs in human flesh.(n)

programme.title: Bugs, Bites and Parasites: Tropical Diseases Uncovered
programme.desc: A retired builder is stung by a scorpion, and a woman fights antibiotic-resistant parasites.(n)

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman find out whether motorcycles are more efficient than cars, while the build team tests a myth about shooting rocket-propelled grenades.(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Jane climb reefs to hunt for octopus, and Jane must face her fear of heights or be trapped by the tide. Plus, Otto struggles to keep a newborn calf alive.(n)

programme.title: Yukon Men
programme.desc: Charlie and Bob go after a bear in its den, while low snowfall forces the villagers to adapt to the lack of available fur.(n)

programme.title: American Guns
programme.desc: The team builds a 12th-century-style hand cannon, and Rich Wyatt teaches Kurt about negotiating when they inspect a collection of semi-automatics.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Following a breakdown, Edgar is forced to undertake a dangerous repair, while Sig loses his temper in the face of questionable counting. On board the Cornelia Marie, Phil's health deteriorates drastically, which begins to affect the crew.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. The evidence against undercover cop Stevie mounts up, suggesting she has thrown away her career for the love of a villain. Stuart finally catches up with the pair, and his suspicions are confirmed when she turns a gun on her colleague and makes her escape. With the violent Tameside Crew wreaking carnage across Sun Hill in pursuit of Towler, Stuart is suspended from duty for being too close to the case. Concludes tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: The discovery of a body sparks the reopening of a murder case Crabbe and Fisher thought they had solved 18 years previously, prompting fears they convicted the wrong man. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim enters the world of secret handshakes and rolled-up trouser legs to investigate the mystery surrounding a disastrous Masonic initiation ceremony. However, as he probes the case, his relationship with Susan begins to show signs of strain. Drama, starring John Nettles and Louise Jameson.(n)

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Calum cooks a meal, but it takes so long to prepare his guests drink too much and pass out before it is ready. Meanwhile, James encounters a dog that faints to gain attention. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy, Christopher Timothy and John McGlynn.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. The evidence against undercover cop Stevie mounts up, suggesting she has thrown away her career for the love of a villain. programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Three.
programme.desc: Part three of three. In a flashback sequence, Stevie reveals to Stuart how she discovered the drug deal was a set-up and why she disobeyed instructions in order to protect her boyfriend. Stuart is astonished that her erratic behaviour was designed to save his life and expose the real villain behind the Tameside Crew. As she makes plans to flee the country, the gang seems always to be two steps ahead of her - and Stevie still has to make the biggest decision of her life.(n)

programme.desc: Judith's former boyfriend Alistair rocks the boat by asking Sandy for a date, and Jean is given cause to feel jealous of Lionel. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank goes to Australia House to discuss his emigration request, but his lack of qualifications leaves the official decidedly unimpressed. Classic comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name.
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Standing and the team reinvestigate the 50-year-old murder of Frederick Tully, a wages clerk at Battersea Power Station. Discovering new evidence that leads them to doubt the man executed for the crime was guilty, they question the validity of the original case against him. Drama, guest starring George Cole, Roy Hudd and Jan Francis.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team re-examines the murder of a junior doctor strangled in 2010. Interviewing her relatives, who are all doctors, staff at her hospital and a surgeon who had been the young woman's tutor, officers hope to identify a lead that was missed during the original investigation. Depressed at the thought of his daughter Holly leaving home for university, Danny finds himself being cheered by his colleagues as they hire a pedibus for a ride through central London. Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The news of his grandmother's death sends Pascoe into mourning, and while sorting her belongings, he discovers his grandfather may have been a First World War deserter. Unable to accept this, he resolves to uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Wield and Dalziel investigate a raid by animal rights activists on a pharmaceutical company. Starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Frances Barber, Shaun Dooley and Jimmy Reddington.(n)

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: The discovery of a body sparks the reopening of a murder case Crabbe and Fisher thought they had solved 18 years previously, prompting fears they convicted the wrong man. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: What Remains
programme.desc: With the inquest into Melissa's death complete, Len becomes more determined than ever to uncover the truth about her murder - but as secrets are revealed another neighbour's life is put in danger. Liz seems determined to expose Michael's affair, so he sets out to wreak revenge, while Joe explains his feelings for the victim and Elaine's efforts to control Peggy rise to dangerous levels. Conclusion of the murder mystery, starring David Threlfall, Russell Tovey, Denise Gough and Indira Varma.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Shepherd is called upon to investigate when a rugby coach's body is found stripped naked and tied to a goal post. Starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are called in to find the murderer of an eight-year-old girl, a case which dredges up disturbing memories for Dalziel, who investigated a similar incident in the same area 15 years earlier. The townsfolk are sure a missing local man is guilty of both crimes, but new evidence soon points toward a more complex solution. Feature-length detective drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan, Joanna David, Ronald Pickup and Kaye Wragg.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: The Dominican Republic, Part One. Part 1 of 2. The family's Dominican Republic vacation gets off to a rocky start when Kourtney causes herself, Kim and Scott to miss their flight(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: The Royal Treatment. Scott visits London with Kim and Rob; Kris tries to get Khloe to see Bruce's dark side(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Affairs of the Everhart. While Bruce finds a golf buddy in supermodel Angie Everhart Kris wonders if she should call up an old 'buddy' of her own. Rob fights with Khloe when he moves back in with her & Lamar(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Parent Trapped. When Kris can't prove her innocence to Bruce the kids force the couple to work out their issues. Kim makes Lamar go the dentist and Rob fears he's losing his hair(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Mothers & Daughters. The girls urge Kris to visit her sick mother in San Diego; Kourtney investigates water birth; Bruce checks into a sleep clinic(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Tales From the Kardashian Krypt. Kris takes estate planning to another level when she starts to arrange her funeral. Kim discovers that Khloe has been chosen as her nephew's guardian(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kardashian Therapy. Part 1 of 2. Oprah Winfrey visits to interview the Kardashian clan, and Rob breaks down during a family therapy session(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kardashian Therapy. Conclusion. Kim tries to work out issues with her sisters; Kendall and Kylie ask to be homeschooled; Kim joins Khloe and Lamar on a trip to Queens(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Cuts Both Ways. Tired of Kourt making all the decisions, Scott considers a vasectomy. Kris goes in for surgery and Kim asks Khloe to go with her to a fertility clinic(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Baby, Baby, Baby. As the family prepares to welcome Kourt's new baby into the world, Khloe looks into why she can't conceive and Kim starts the process to freeze her eggs(n)

programme.title: E! News
programme.desc: The latest in entertainment news from Hollywood every day - the stars, the glamour, the gossip and more! If you like celebrities, we speak your language(n)

programme.title: The Arrangement

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Ms. Knope Goes to Washington. Sens. John McCain (R-Ariz.), Olympia Snowe (R-Maine) and Barbara Boxer (D-Cal.) guest star in the Season 5 opener, which finds Leslie and Andy in Washington, D.C., visiting Ben and April at their new jobs. Back in Pawnee, Ron hosts a barbecue for the entire Parks and Recreation staff(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Soda Tax. Leslie decides to wage war on obesity in Pawnee in her first mission as city councilor by passing a city-wide soda tax. Meanwhile, Andy tries to get in shape for his police-entrance exam, and Ben struggles to connect with the interns in his office(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.sub-title: How a Bill Becomes a Law
programme.desc: How a Bill Becomes a Law. Leslie helps a local swim team get more practice time by working on a new law that extends the hours at the community pool; Ron finds himself filling a pothole for a local woman (Lucy Lawless) as part of Chris' new plan to solve citizens' problems around the city; April and Ben take a road trip to Pawnee(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Sex Education. Leslie responds to an STD outbreak among Pawnee seniors by conducting her own sex-education class. At the same time, Tom finds himself gadget-less and turning to Ron for help coping with life without technology and Ben and April have their first encounter with Congressman Murray(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Halloween Surprise. Halloween brings some upsetting news for Leslie in the form of a job offer for Ben. At the same time, Ron and Andy go trick-or-treating with Diane's daughters, while Tom looks for a new business venture(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Ben's Parents. Leslie is apprehensive about meeting Ben's divorced parents for the first time; Tom turns to Jean-Ralphio for help pitching his new business venture to Ron; and Chris finds himself on an emotional roller coaster(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie vs. April. Leslie disapproves of April's plan to transform a lot into a dog park, while Ben gets roped into helping Tom launch his new business venture, and Andy finds himself playing crime-scene investigator(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Pawnee Commons. Leslie becomes suspicious when an architect from Eagleton responds to her public appeal for park suggestions. Meanwhile, Tom sets up his rent-a-swag business with help from the office; and Andy adds some excitement to his new gig as a security guard(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Ron and Diane. Ron's new girlfriend, Diane, meets his ex-wife Tammy Two when they all attend a woodworking-awards dinner. At the same time, Jerry throws a holiday party and not everyone is invited(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Two Parties. Councilman Jamm inserts himself into the hens' night that Ann has planned for Leslie; at the same time, Chris throws a game night with the guys in honour of Ben's last days as a single man(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Women in Garbage. Leslie's push to get more women in government jobs results in her and April collecting garbage. Meanwhile, Tom asks Andy and Ben to teach him about basketball; and Ron takes on the responsibility of watching Diane's kids while their babysitter is out of town(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Ann's Decision. A string of failed relationships leads Ann to make a dramatic life decision. Meanwhile, Ben seeks advice on choosing a caterer for the wedding from Chris, Tom and Ron; and April is left with a task that Leslie usually handles(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Emergency Response. Plans to raise money for the park at a black-tie gala get thrown off track when Leslie is forced to take part in a citywide emergency-response drill. Meanwhile, Andy prepares to take the police-academy exam, and Ron fills in for Leslie on "Pawnee Today"(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie and Ben. Leslie and Ben have two hours to complete a yearlong project; at the same time, Ron's temper gets him in trouble(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Correspondents' Lunch. Leslie is at a loss for words after the speech she prepared for a special event is stolen. Meanwhile, Ben begins his new job at the Sweetums Charity Foundation; and Ann summons the courage to ask an important question(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Bailout. Leslie is determined to help a local video store stay in business, while Chris offers Tom advice on how to deal with a difficult employee. Elsewhere, Ann resorts to blackmail to get April to be her friend(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Partridge. Leslie accompanies Ben on a trip to his hometown of Partridge, Minnesota, where he has been offered a key to the city. Meanwhile, Ron deals with a lawsuit filed against him by Councilman Jamm and at the same time, Ann and Chris take a parenting compatibility quiz(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Animal Control. Leslie decides to overhaul the Animal Control Department, while Ann seeks medical attention for Ron. Elsewhere, Ben, Tom and Andy set out to recruit donors for their charity foundation(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Article Two. Leslie's latest goal is to get rid of laws that no longer make sense, while April and Ron receive management training from Chris. Elsewhere, Ben finds himself in a bidding war against Ann to win a present for Leslie(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Jerry's Retirement. Leslie wants to do something special to celebrate Jerry's retirement; at the same time, Chris and Ann prepare to have a baby together; and Tom worries about how Jerry's departure will affect him(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Swing Vote. Budget-cut proposals submitted by Ron would close down the local minigolf course, which seems unacceptable to Leslie. Elsewhere, Andy and Ben celebrate a big donation made to their charity; and Ann tries to solve Tom's girlfriend troubles(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Are You Better Off?. Season 5 ends with Leslie celebrating her first year as a city councilwoman; and Andy calling his alter ego, FBI agent Burt Macklin, out of retirement to help with an investigation. Elsewhere, April receives life-changing news; and Tom considers a big business opportunity(n)

programme.desc: Lolo Jones. Chronicling former LSU hurdler Lolo Jones' unsettled upbringing in Iowa and her track accomplishments in the SEC and beyond. LSU coach Dennis Shaver and Olympic legend Jackie Joyner-Kersee are among those interviewed(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Fantastic Lies. A 10-year retrospective on the 2006 Duke Lacrosse case in which three players were charged with rape, only to have all charges dropped a year later. Director Marina Zenovich explores the case's hot-button issues of sex, race, class and violence, and the turbulent period's lasting impact on the players and the program(n)

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Catching Kayla. The story of Lipscomb University distance runner Kayla Montgomery, who continues to race despite being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, which causes her legs to go numb at the end of races and workouts. Tom Rinaldi reports(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Lolo Jones. Chronicling former LSU hurdler Lolo Jones' unsettled upbringing in Iowa and her track accomplishments in the SEC and beyond. LSU coach Dennis Shaver and Olympic legend Jackie Joyner-Kersee are among those interviewed(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: I Hate Christian Laettner. An in-depth profile of polarizing Duke basketball great Christian Laettner, the only player to start in four consecutive Final Fours. Rory Karpf directs a "gloves-off" examination of the man who has been seen by many as the "Blue Devil Himself."(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Survive and Advance. North Carolina State's improbable run to the 1983 NCAA basketball title is chronicled. Wolfpack guard Dereck Whittenburg helps tell the story of nine postseason wins under coach Jim Valvano, whose 1993 death capped a heartbreaking aftermath for the team(n)

programme.title: China's 10 Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The wildlife presenter, author and ornithologist travels to the Far East for a closer look at China's deadliest snakes.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Part one of two. Recent telescope images are combined with CGI technology to illustrate the sights and sounds of alien worlds. Powerful modern telescopes and unmanned space missions have revealed a wide range of dynamic environments, prompting scientists to expand their ideas about the possibility that life may be present elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: The Saturn V Story
programme.desc: Documentary following the `space race' of the 1960s, focusing on the USA's multi-billion dollar space program. Featuring Nasa footage, visual effects and interviews with Apollo scientists to construct a timeline of President Kennedy's 1961 pledge to put a man on the moon by the end of the decade, and the reality of 24 individuals successfully making the journey in the Saturn V rocket.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.(n)

programme.title: China's 10 Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The wildlife presenter, author and ornithologist travels to the Far East for a closer look at China's deadliest snakes.(n)

programme.title: India's New Worlds
programme.desc: Concluding part of the documentary charting some of the many wildlife conservation projects currently being pursued in India.(n)

programme.title: Life on Earth
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Attenborough explains the development of creatures with spinal columns, such as mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish.(n)

programme.title: Hurricane Hunters
programme.desc: In the Gulf of Mexico, Tropical Storm Lee pops up suddenly, and there are concerns the Hunters' base in Biloxi, Mississippi, is in its potential path. As Major Sean Cross' crew tries to determine Lee's exact direction, they must balance their duty with worries for their families in the region.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Roughly once every 40 years in the northern Kalahari Desert of Botswana an ancient waterway called the Savute channel fills and flows into the surrounding marshes. This attracts thousands of grazing animals from across the region - and also draws predators to the area. This documentary follows the fortunes of Africa's largest herd of elephants and a pride of seven lions as they come face to face in an epic fight for survival, with drought having weakened the elephants and the lions desperately hungry. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Conclusion. Foremost astrobiologists explain how the latest telescope images and feedback from unmanned space missions are extending the possibility that life may exist elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Guts: The Strange and Wonderful World of the Human Stomach
programme.desc: TV presenter Michael Mosley takes part in an experiment at the Science Museum in London, where a small pill camera takes viewers on a journey through his digestive system. He visits a gastroenterologist, who explains the link between personality and pain response, and learns about the advent of faecal transplants increasingly used to treat people with serious stomach and bowel disorders.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Northmen - A Viking Saga
programme.desc: In this action epic, a clan of vikings kidnap the king of Scotland's daughter and hold her for ransom. In response, the king sends a horde of mercenaries after the vikings to retrieve his only offspring, setting off a vicious battle for survival(n)

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: The harrowing tale of two very different men when their plane crashes in the hostile Alaskan wilderness(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life and forced to move cities. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: Father of Invention
programme.desc: In this poignant comedy, disgraced businessman Robert Axle works as a janitor after serving a prison sentence for gross negligence, and eventually he decides to rebuild his fortune by creating a new gadget(n)

programme.title: Cheaper by the Dozen 2
programme.desc: The jumbo-sized Baker family are back in this sequel to the 2003 box-office hit Cheaper by the Dozen. College football coach Tom Baker (Steve Martin) and his wife, author Kate Baker (Bonnie Hunt), have decided its time they took their sizable brood of 12 children on a summer vacation, and so they pack up the cars and take the kids to Lake Winnetka for some camping. Not all the kids are happy about this, but the one who is really annoyed turns out to be Tom, who discovers his old rival Jimmy Murtaugh (Eugene Levy) is also staying near the lake. Jimmy and his trophy wife, Sarina (Carmen Electra), also have a large family of eight children, and Jimmy and Tom seem intent upon one-upping each other at every opportunity. As the tensions mount, the Baker family and the Murtaugh clan face off in a not-so-good-natured series of family games to determine which of the parents have the greater bragging rights. In addition to Steve Martin and Bonnie Hunt, the actors playing the 12 Baker children from the 2003 film return for Cheaper by the Dozen 2, including Hilary Duff, Piper Perabo, Tom Welling, and Kevin Schmidt(n)

programme.title: The Out-of-Towners
programme.desc: Remake of the 1970 comedy classic that follows the adventures of a couple vexed by misfortune whilst in New York City(n)

programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life and forced to move cities. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The prequel to the 1964 comic gem of the same name stars Steve Martin as hapless Inspector Clouseau, investigating murder and the theft of a priceless jewel(n)

programme.title: Courage Under Fire
programme.desc: Meg Ryan stars in this action thriller as Captain Karen Walden, one of the US military's bravest officials. Recently killed in action, Captain Walden has been nominated for a Medal of Honour in recognition for her services, but an investigation into the circumstances surrounding her death has yet to be completed. Lieutenant Colonel Nathaniel Serling (Denzel Washington) is charged with looking into Walden's behaviour in the line of duty and assessing whether she really did display courage under fire(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: In the frightmarish tradition of "The Blair Witch Project" comes this nerve-jangling chiller. Jennifer Carpenter is outstanding as a TV reporter who gets confined to a quarantined apartment complex in Los Angeles that houses a mysterious, scary secret. It isn't long before she learns why someone was "screaming bloody murder." A remake of the 2007 Spanish horror film "REC." Directed by John Erick Dowdle, who cowrote the script with Drew Dowdle. Steve Harris, Jay Hernandez, Johnathon Schaech(n)

programme.title: Untraceable
programme.desc: Faced with the most baffling and menacing case of her life, FBI agent and cybercop Jennifer Marsh (Diane Lane) must race against the clock to stop a deadly Internet predator in his tracks -- before more innocent lives are extinguished. So begins director Gregory Hoblit's (Primal Fear) heart-stopping thriller Untraceable. The psychopath at hand is far from an ordinary villain; a megalomaniacal showman with a flair for sadistic braggadocio and astonishing technical knowhow, his expertise makes it infinitely more difficult for Marsh to track him down(n)

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: The harrowing tale of two very different men when their plane crashes in the hostile Alaskan wilderness(n)

programme.title: Northmen - A Viking Saga
programme.desc: In this action epic, a clan of vikings kidnap the king of Scotland's daughter and hold her for ransom. In response, the king sends a horde of mercenaries after the vikings to retrieve his only offspring, setting off a vicious battle for survival(n)

programme.title: The Lonely Guy
programme.desc: A would-be novelist tries to cope with single life in New York City(n)

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: An actor disguises himself as a woman to land a job on a TV soap, fooling his agent, his costar and maybe himself(n)

programme.title: Shattered
programme.desc: A sociopathic kidnapper methodically pushes a desperate pair of parents to their absolute breaking point in this thriller starring Piece Brosnan, Gerard Butler, and Maria Bello. Life has been good to happily married Chicago couple Neil (Butler) and Abby (Bello); their flames in their relationship are still burning bright, Neil has a great job, and with the birth of their beautiful daughter Sophie the loving couple has grown into a budding family. So much can change in an instant though, and the moment that sadistic kidnapper Ryan (Brosnan) appears the fibers of this happy family are torn violently apart. Ryan knows everything there is to know about Neil, Abby, and Sophie, and now he's ready to use that information to put the two parents through the most excruciating experience of their entire lives. Should Neil and Abby not comply with Ryan's every demand over the course of the next twenty-four hours, he will kill young Sophie without a second thought. While at first the demands seem typical of your average kidnapper, they gradually begin to grow increasingly outlandish until it becomes obvious that Ryan doesn't want money, but simply enjoys the power that comes along with systematically dismantling their idyllic lives until there's nothing left for Neil and Abby to live for. Now left with nothing to lose, the monstrous Ryan finds out just how far a parent is willing to go in order to save their child when he commands Neil to commit one final act of annihilation that goes against everything the loving father and husband stands for(n)

programme.title: This Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged African-American family gathers for a yuletide reunion in Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: Roxanne dreams of a handsome, intelligent, romantic man. C.D. Bales is two out of three... but looks aren't everything! Stars Steve Martin(n)

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: A photographer who witnessed his famous mountaineer father's death as a child must face his fears and rescue his sister who is trapped on K2 at 26,000 feet. Feeling responsible for his father's fatal accident, the young man had given up climbing but when his sister and her team become trapped after an avalanche, he must enlist the help of experts in order to save the group(n)

programme.title: Kickboxer 5: The Redemption
programme.desc: Living up to its tagline, "Payback can be deadly," this installment in the popular-on-video Kickboxer series follows the travails of a displaced fighter out to avenge his friend's death. Stepping in for former hero Sasha Mitchell -- who in turn stepped in for original Kickboxer Jean-Claude Van Damme -- is Mark Dacascos, playing Matt Reeves, the longtime buddy of David Sloan (formerly Mitchell, here played by an uncredited actor). When he finds out that Sloan was murdered after refusing to join a nefarious boxing organization, Reeves travels to South Africa to get Bollen (Greg Latter), the evil leader of the cult-like federation. Redemption: Kickboxer 5 was given the "Redemption" prefix upon its 2003 video release(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Part one of two. A tourist yacht cruising off the coast of Somalia opens fire on a boat, killing a sheikh and his wife. Goren and Eames investigate and find a link to a Somali arms dealer at the centre of a federal case, and are shocked to discover that Captain Danny Ross could be implicated. The crime drama returns, starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Eric Bogosian.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: When JJ LaRoche's house is robbed, he personally requests Jane's help with the case. The former head of CBI internal affairs tells Jane that one of the thieves got away with the secret plastic container he's kept hidden for nine years and begs him to solve the case before the contents are revealed and his life is destroyed. LaRoche suspects that the person responsible for high-level security leaks inside the agency is also behind the theft of the box. Guest starring Pruitt Taylor Vince, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Red John strikes again just as Jane narrows down the list of people who could be the serial killer to seven suspects, and the subsequent investigation uncovers a link between the victim and the CBI consultant. Guest starring Laura San Giacomo (Saving Grace, Pretty Woman), with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a pregnant woman with a drug habit. Goren and Eames focus their search on the victim's boyfriend and are highly suspicious of his story, but further evidence leads them to realise other members of his wealthy family may have been involved. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of church sexton Morris Abernathy and discover the victim had a relationship with the killer, leading to a widening scandal involving money embezzled from the collection funds. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The driver of a Ferrari is gunned down by a motorcyclist and the victim is identified as petty officer Colin Boxer, who was holding down a second job as a valet parker and had borrowed the sports car. The owner of the vehicle turns out to be Vijay Chaya, the billionaire head of a large corporation, and the team suspects a case of mistaken identity. During the course of the investigation, Gibbs chances on a medal awarded to Leroy Jethro Moore, the man he was named after and an estranged friend of his father. Guest starring Billy Dee Williams (The Empire Strikes Back) and Ralph Waite (The Waltons).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when it is revealed that a series of female murder victims are all ex-girlfriends of a notoriously abusive lawyer. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A conman is found beaten to death in a hotel room, prompting Goren and Eames to look for a group of investors he swindled. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony reviews satellite footage of rebel forces in the Middle East and spots Kersey among a group of insurgents, concluding that Joe Westcott's fear of him was well-founded. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. Lydia's Navy captain father David Wade was shot dead during the attack and her mother is overseas, so Ziva offers to look after the girl, while Abby tries to jog her memory by creating facial reconstructions of the attackers based on some grainy CCTV footage. DiNozzo and McGee find links on Rosie's laptop to possible suspect John `Diesel' Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: David tries to find his way out of a very unique predicament. Superhero thriller, starring Dan Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Cleveland and Quagmire help throw Jesus an important birthday party after running into the Son of God at the Quahog Mall. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Stewie, Chris and Brian's Excellent Adventure.
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian use their time machine to help Chris pass his history test so he does not have to re-sit the whole year, but trouble ensues when the trio all get stuck in the past.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A brush with death gives Brian a new lease of life, which he capitalises on by becoming a singer and performing with Frank Sinatra Jr. Meanwhile, Meg finally finds acceptance by pretending to be a lesbian.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A chance encounter with a star quarterback at a school reunion lands Peter a place on the New England Patriots American football team - but success goes to his head. Meanwhile, Stewie becomes a sports bookie. With the voices of American football player Tom Brady, actress Carol Channing, sportscaster Bob Costas and chat show host Jay Leno.(n)

programme.title: Samurai Jack
programme.desc: The time-displaced warrior's will to survive is pushed to the absolute limit by a relentless surprise attack by an unseen foe.(n)

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.sub-title: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.
programme.desc: Rick runs into some old associates, which results in a fall out with Morty.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.sub-title: The Best Little Horror House in Langley Falls.

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois shows Meg how to have fun during a spring break at the beach, while Peter rashly takes out a loan and buys a boat, determined to try his hand at commercial fishing.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie persuades Brian to take it slow with his new girlfriend Carolyn, warning him that women do not like to be rushed - but she grows impatient and goes off with Cleveland instead.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter becomes so obsessed with 1963 hit single Surfin' Bird that Brian and Stewie go on a mission to destroy every copy. Their search leads them to a record store in Quahog, where they bump into Jesus - who has important news for them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger is offended by the family during his birthday celebrations, and vows to turn his life around - and take revenge. However, the alien takes things a step too far, causing the family to go on the run.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.desc: Part two of two. Goren is pushed over the edge and tries to attack Jan Van Dekker after Agent Stahl gets her hands on him first, leading to a suspension. Nichols and Eames continue their bid to bring Ross's killer to justice without him, and are assisted by Detective Serena Stevens, newly arrived from Chicago. Saffron Burrows joins the cast of the crime drama.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when it is revealed that a series of female murder victims are all ex-girlfriends of a notoriously abusive lawyer. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A conman is found beaten to death in a hotel room, prompting Goren and Eames to look for a group of investors he swindled. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony reviews satellite footage of rebel forces in the Middle East and spots Kersey among a group of insurgents, concluding that Joe Westcott's fear of him was well-founded. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. Lydia's Navy captain father David Wade was shot dead during the attack and her mother is overseas, so Ziva offers to look after the girl, while Abby tries to jog her memory by creating facial reconstructions of the attackers based on some grainy CCTV footage. DiNozzo and McGee find links on Rosie's laptop to possible suspect John `Diesel' Stevens.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. She accepts the help of a retired marine colonel when he comes forward with information about the murders - but begins to believe he knows more than he is letting on. Drama, with Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives hunt a killer responsible for murdering hospital patients by lacing pain medication with cyanide. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: After a reporter and his fiancee are gunned down outside a restaurant, Goren and Eames are given a seemingly reliable eyewitness description of the killer. However, while on the trail of their suspect, they discover the journalist was planning to publish an expose on corruption within the sanitation industry, taking their investigation in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to the scene when there is an attempt on the life of FBI agent TC Fornell, with the assailant identified as Navy seaman Tyler Brown. Joe Spano and Melinda McGraw guest star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels reprise their roles as lovable imbeciles Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne in this sequel to Dumb and Dumber from original directing duo Bobby and Peter Farrelly. The movie revisits the titular duo of dumb Harry (Daniels) and dumber Lloyd (Carrey), 20 years after the events of the first film: Harry pays his first visit to his parents since the early '90s, and discovers a two-decade-old postcard from a gal he hooked up with (Kathleen Turner) informing him that she's pregnant. It turns out she had a daughter and put the girl up for adoption. Harry is moved by the prospect of having an adult child out there somewhere (and it just so happens that he needs a kidney transplant), so he and Lloyd embark on a road trip to track down his daughter. They get mixed up in many wacky situations along the way, like finding and stealing their old "Shaggin' Wagon," and being duped into pleasuring an old lady in exchange for her hearing aids(n)

Milhouse decides to live each day to the fullest, comes out of his shell and professes his love for Lisa, only to have his heart broken. programme.desc: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting. Art-class-hating Bart creates a voodoo doll of his art teacher, and when she becomes pregnant from the spell cast on her, the student becomes a hero to Springfield couples trying to conceive. Unfortunately, this spurs kidnappers to snatch Bart in an effort to conceive a thoroughbred racehorse(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Archer

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Midnight Ron. Ron Cadillac's past is revealed and step-father and son bonding occur as Ron rescues Sterling Archer from a drunken debauch in Canada. Woodhouse eats spider webs(n)

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: A backwoods trapper signs up as a cavalry scout at a fort manned by inexperienced soldiers, where he falls in love with a colonel's wife. On taking over command of the garrison, the officer plans to lead his men in a reckless attack on a hostile Indian tribe - and it is down to the frontiersman to save his comrades from a massacre. Western, starring Victor Mature, Robert Preston and Anne Bancroft.(n)

programme.title: Trapeze
programme.desc: Two circus performers fall for a seductive newcomer, leading to all manner of amorous antics and rivalry as each pulls out all the stops to win her heart. Drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Tony Curtis, Gina Lollobrigida, Katy Jurado, Thomas Gomez and Sid James.(n)

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: An egocentric professor leads an expedition on a journey into the Amazon on a mission to prove his theory that dinosaurs still survive there. On arrival, they find the prehistoric beasts are all too real - and only one of the dangers they face. Fantasy adventure, based on Arthur Conan Doyle's classic novel, starring Claude Rains, Michael Rennie and Jill St John.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Jack
programme.desc: A bumbling midshipman's uniform is stolen by a woman desperate to go to sea, who adopts his identity. Later, the hapless sailor is press-ganged on to the same ship as her. However, while trying to prove who he really is, he has to contend with mutinies, pirates and the Spanish Navy. Comedy, with Bernard Cribbins, Juliet Mills, Kenneth Williams and Charles Hawtrey.(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.(n)

programme.title: Last Vegas
programme.desc: A sixtysomething confirmed bachelor finally decides to settle down with his much younger girlfriend. He and three friends decide to mark the occasion by reliving their wild youth with a trip to Las Vegas - but they find that both the city and each other have changed since their glory days. Comedy, starring Michael Douglas, Robert De Niro, Morgan Freeman and Kevin Kline.(n)

programme.title: Girlhood
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenage girl longs to escape her abusive family life and her male dominated neighbourhood. She finds solace in joining an all-female gang and having a relationship with an older man, but begins to realise that far more drastic steps are needed if she is to ever have the independence she craves. Drama, starring Karidja Toure and Assa Sylla. In French.(n)

programme.title: Hope Springs
programme.desc: A middle-aged married woman feels her long-standing relationship with her unadventurous husband is becoming stale. When she hears of a marriage counsellor offering therapy sessions in his remote retreat, she persuades her reluctant spouse to join her for a week with the doctor rediscovering why they fell in love in the first place. Romantic comedy, with Meryl Streep, Tommy Lee Jones and Steve Carell.(n)

programme.title: Cattle Empire
programme.desc: A trail boss, released from prison after serving five years following a rampage by his men, accepts a job from the community's leading citizen to head up a cattle drive. However, he still harbours a grudge against his employers and seizes the chance for revenge when a rival cattle baron makes him a tempting offer. Western, starring Joel McCrea, Gloria Talbott, Don Haggerty and Phyllis Coates.(n)

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley.(n)

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew get lost in the desert during the retreat from El Alamein and face a desperate race against time to reach a source of water in an abandoned fortress - only to discover the Nazis are heading for the same location. Second World War melodrama which is all the more effective thanks to the straightforward nature of the plot and action. Humphrey Bogart, J Carrol Naish, Dan Duryea and Rex Ingram are among the excellent cast.(n)

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: Legendary outlaw Robin Hood returns to England after the Crusades and goes in search of his beloved Marian, who is now an abbess, and crosses swords once again with old enemy the Sheriff of Nottingham. Medieval adventure, starring Sean Connery, Audrey Hepburn, Robert Shaw, Nicol Williamson, Ronnie Barker, Denholm Elliott and Richard Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
programme.desc: An introverted 15-year-old fails to fit in at a 1990s high school as he copes with personal traumas and his own social awkwardness. He finally finds a place to belong when two older students take him under their wing. Drama based on director Stephen Chbosky's novel, starring Logan Lerman, Emma Watson and Ezra Miller.(n)

programme.title: Lockout
programme.desc: A government agent is framed for murder, and sentenced to a prison on board a space station. Before he can be sent there, a riot takes place in the penitentiary and the convicts seize control, holding the president's daughter hostage. The condemned man is offered a pardon if he can rescue her. Sci-fi thriller, starring Guy Pearce and Maggie Grace.(n)

programme.desc: The five remaining bakers turn farm-fresh vegetables into veggie desserts, and pay homage to a traditional farmhouse breakfast with bacon and egg desserts.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. In New Orleans he calls at a Creole restaurant run by a self-styled gumbo queen, and is given the opportunity to learn the art of alligator hunting.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a child-inspired restaurant in Memphis that serves fried chicken, and a Thai restaurant in Hawaii that is known for its spicy dishes.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a summer shack in Narragansett that serves clam cakes cooked in beef fat, and a restaurant in St Louis that is known for its cheese fries and duck.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Pop star Paloma Faith relives childhood memories by preparing a Portuguese salt cod dish at the pop-up cafe on Southend Pier. Jamie Oliver serves sticky Chinese ribs, Jimmy Doherty brews his own DIY craft beer, and the boys take up the case of the delicious and nutritious meats that have fallen out of favour.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine tackles more than a typical restaurant when he heads to Cocoamoda - a fancy French bistro, complete with an event space and a chocolate boutique.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Looney's BBQ calls the Mystery Diners crew to investigate whether his staff are pranking their customers with extremely hot sauce.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Source in San Francisco contacts Charles for help after hearing rumours that customers are being served meat at his vegan restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Rebecca rebuffs Sam and tells him that in future she'll only date men who can advance her career. Ted Danson stars.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: One Happy Chappy in a Snappy Serape.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rebecca faces a dilemma after she is forced to choose her man, and has difficulty deciding whether Martin or Sam will prove to be the lesser of two evils. Bar-room comedy, guest starring Alex Nevil, with Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: Comedy highlights, courtesy of the frantic funnyman with the fez, featuring his unique style of magical illusion.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon is disgusted to see the staff compete fiercely for the coveted title of employee of the month and a trip for two to Paris. Colin's attempts to impress his boss with a spectacular magic act end in disaster.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: When Gavin goes missing on a staff weekend, everyone assumes the worst. Brittas even sets the wheels in motion to arrange his subordinate's funeral. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: The Rabbit and the Pussy Cat.
programme.desc: Timothy joins in a treasure hunt to find a golden rabbit which has been buried in the area. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible `test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible.
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harper household is thrown into turmoil after a famous heart-throb visits Ben's surgery, but while Susan is busy swooning, Michael spots a money-making opportunity. Guest starring Peter Capaldi, alongside Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon is disgusted to see the staff compete fiercely for the coveted title of employee of the month and a trip for two to Paris. Colin's attempts to impress his boss with a spectacular magic act end in disaster.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: When Gavin goes missing on a staff weekend, everyone assumes the worst. Brittas even sets the wheels in motion to arrange his subordinate's funeral. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo speculates why blood rushes to the head when upside down but not to the feet while standing up, so Seymour sets up an experiment to demonstrate the way the body works. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: The friends gather for Joyce's retirement party, where John has made a tribute video - but forgotten to ask Trevor for his contribution - and Maureen latches onto a trendy young couple. Alan also has bad news that might ruin proceedings - unless the guest of honour spoils it first by confronting her neighbour about her kids' unruly behaviour. Alison Steadman and Philip Jackson star in the sitcom, with Russ Abbot, Stephanie Beacham, Paula Wilcox and James Smith.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: Series examining the making of the ever-popular prison sitcom, featuring contributions from cast members, writers and fans.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is disappointed to discover she is not invited to Maria's hen party because of her age, and decides to gatecrash the event, only to end up at the wrong venue. She then tries to impress the bride-to-be's mother during a dinner date, but is so nervous she turns to drink, and the evening descends into chaos. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Harry Enfield and Chums
programme.desc: Comedy sketches with the funnyman and partners in mirth Paul Whitehouse and Kathy Burke. Featuring characters including Kevin and Perry, Tim Nice-But-Dim and the Self Righteous Brothers.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Il Cenobio dei Dogi, Camogli.
programme.desc: Sequel to improvised comedy The Trip, with Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon once again playing versions of themselves. The two comedy actors are asked to embark on another round of restaurant reviews for a Sunday newspaper, this time in Italy. Steve is on hiatus from his American TV series and isn't drinking while Rob is looking to unwind with his time away from his young family. They begin their trip in Piedmont at the Trattoria Della Posta before stopping at the poet Byron's former house in Genoa on their way to the Cenobio dei Dogi in Camogli. Michael Winterbottom directs.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark feels the need to impress Dobby and gets a lucky break when his book Business Secrets of the Pharaohs is accepted by a publisher. Jeremy enrols on a life-coaching course, but things become complicated when he sleeps with his tutor. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Simon invites Dobby, Mark, Jeremy and Super Hans to join him and his friends for a paintballing weekend. Mark thinks that Simon is using the weekend as a cover to get back with Dobby, while Jeremy is convinced he can be a life coach to one of the party. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A by-the-book Los Angeles cop is paired with a laidback new partner to investigate the nefarious activities of a TV evangelist and a pornographic-magazine baron suspected of operating a criminal cult. Comedy spoof of the 1950s TV series, starring Dan Aykroyd, Tom Hanks, Christopher Plummer and the original show's star Harry Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer host the wacky quiz, with guests Shane Richie, Simon Bates, Caroline Aherne and Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer introduce the madcap celebrity game show. Team captains Mark Lamarr and Ulrika Jonsson are joined by guests David Baddiel, Muriel Gray, Paul Shane and Annabel Giles.(n)

programme.desc: Frasier and Lilith discover Norm's hidden talents as an interior designer and recommend him to their friends - but he soon finds himself leading a double life. Meanwhile, Woody worries about Cliff's psychiatric problems.(n)

programme.desc: In a feeble attempt to prove their masculinity, Norm, Woody and Cliff pretend they've been skydiving - but a revelation from Rebecca makes Sam decide to take the plunge for real. Comedy, starring Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Seymour visit an old friend in hospital following his hernia operation and go to extraordinary lengths to cheer him up. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star in the first episode to feature Clem `Smiler' Hemmingway (Stephen Lewis).(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour sets about proving that skiing does not have to be an expensive sport. However, with snow in short supply he determines that he, Compo and Clegg need to use dinner trays. Long-running rural comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Day of the Welsh Ferret.
programme.desc: Compo has an interesting experience when he loses his ferret as the trio make their way to a friend's funeral.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Bored with the everyday routine in the Harper household, Susan decides to lead her life as a free and single girl again. Janey takes the opportunity to step into the role of home-maker and Ben simply runs away. Domestic comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Eddie hatches a get-rich-quick scheme that actually works - until a psychotic counterfeiter gets wind of his activities and demands a cut of the proceeds. Comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The grubby duo steal a car and discover the tickets for the unfortunate owner's honeymoon inside. Taking advantage of their find, they try to pass themselves off as the happy couple, but needless to say, the whole trip soon becomes a nightmare.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: The zoo's oldest gorilla falls gravely ill, so Bob persuades Howard to dress in an ape suit so he can collect sponsorship money on its behalf. Howard proves so convincing he even fools the Grim Reaper, who hauls him off to Ape Hell.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Howard and Vince travel to the Arctic in an attempt to beat Dixon Bainbridge to the legendary egg of Mantumbi. The duo come face to face with ice demon Black Frost, and befriend a polar bear. Surreal comedy, starring Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah
programme.desc: It is Halloween and the team is given the task of creating a spooky masterpiece.(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah
programme.desc: The team makes chocolate stilettos and a cake celebrating a 40-year-old piece of moon rock.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Ed Byrne hosts the final edition, joined by four more well-known faces hoping to inspire people to get baking for Comic Relief. Comedian and actress Victoria Wood, former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, model and TV presenter Alexa Chung and Asylum star Kayvan Novak are the hopefuls, who will be tackling a traybake, rustling up a dozen crumpets and getting creative with a vegetable cake that must also double as a self portrait. Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood taste the results and decide who will be crowned Star Baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each create a savoury sabayon sauce and use it to make a glaze for seafood. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare French pork pie stuffed with chestnuts and apple and served with a British salad cream, before the contenders prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: In the final instalment of their culinary journey through the history of British cuisine, Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, discussing how certain ingredients and recipes can give people a sense of well-being, such as chicken noodle soup and a simple fish dish.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. Jess chooses a batch of hens from a battery egg farm as the Bristol experiment to turn an acre of derelict city land into a smallholding continues. Back at River Cottage, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall organises a foraging competition and finds his ducklings hatch days early.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Ed Byrne hosts the final edition, joined by four more well-known faces hoping to inspire people to get baking for Comic Relief. Comedian and actress Victoria Wood, former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, model and TV presenter Alexa Chung and Asylum star Kayvan Novak are the hopefuls, who will be tackling a traybake, rustling up a dozen crumpets and getting creative with a vegetable cake that must also double as a self portrait. Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood taste the results and decide who will be crowned Star Baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each create a savoury sabayon sauce and use it to make a glaze for seafood. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare French pork pie stuffed with chestnuts and apple and served with a British salad cream, before the contenders prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The next two semi-finalists work a shift at Michelin-starred restaurant Midsummer House in Cambridge. The pair must recreate chef patron Daniel Clifford's signature dish of rosemary-smoked rump of lamb, courgette and basil puree, piquillo pepper puree and a courgette and yoghurt dressing. They then face a final test - drawing on what they have learnt from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Gregg Wallace, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: In the final instalment of their culinary journey through the history of British cuisine, Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, discussing how certain ingredients and recipes can give people a sense of well-being, such as chicken noodle soup and a simple fish dish.(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah

programme.title: The Great Sport Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Well-known faces compete in the 2012 charity competition, hosted by Mel Giedroyc. Actresses Sarah Hadland and Angela Griffin, botanist James Wong and TV gardener Joe Swift take part in the first heat, challenged to produce a traybake, a perfect batch of wholemeal cheese scones and a meringue dessert, but only one of them will earn a place in the final. Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry are the judges.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining four chefs from an earlier heat who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to shape rolls, baguettes and four-plait loaves from bread dough. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's fish soup made with champagne, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate British pork, preparing a traditional gala pie and a rolled loin with apricots and ginger. They also explore the role the pig has played in the UK's history and travel to a farm in Gloucestershire to visit a couple raising rare breeds.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the arrival of summer with a fair. He prepares elderflower champagne and the Bristol families spit-roast pigs, lamb and goat. The final crops he still has to harvest are peas, gooseberries and wet garlic, at which time he will have experienced all that his land has to offer during his favourite season of the year.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the state of Rajasthan, a land of palaces and hilltop forts, where he cooks a biryani fit for a royal banquet. He then heads north to the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh, and joins local nobility at a gathering in their home village and has an audience with the Dalai Lama.(n)
