programme.desc: John McClane takes on terrorists targeting government computer systems(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A single father who has just found success as the host of an outrageous television talk show begins to question his path in life when he returns home to attend his parents' 50th wedding anniversary party in the company of his famous fiancée -- a reality television star -- in this crisis-of-conscience comedy starring Martin Lawrence. RJ Stevens (Lawrence) is a television talk-show sensation who has transcended his modest Southern beginnings to become the most popular self-help guru ever to grace the small screen. His show, "Team of Me," is a ratings juggernaut, his fiancée is a beautiful reality television star, and his pockets are always lined with large bills. There are few Tinseltown dreams that RJ hasn't already achieved, so when his parents announce their 50th wedding anniversary, the family-oriented television star immediately drops everything and sets his sights on Georgia. As a boy, RJ was always the target of ridicule within his family, but these days things are different; not only does RJ have a ten-year-old son, but his bride-to-be is admired by countless viewers all across the globe on a weekly basis. But RJ's egotistical West Coast attitude simply doesn't fly in the South, and when his lovable but relentless family refuses to cut him any slack due to his current superstar status, he must finally pause and take stock of the man he has become. Louis C.K., Cedric the Entertainer, Michael Clarke Duncan, and James Earl Jones co-star in a Southern-flavored family comedy written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.desc: Jimmy Neutron is a boy genius. When parents all over Earth are kidnapped by aliens, it's up to him to lead all the children of the world to their rescue!(n)

programme.desc: When a man suffers a humiliating defeat at the hands of the office bully in front of his own daughter, he decides that enough is enough. Soon, he is enlisting the help of a washed-up film star to show the office bully a few tricks(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: A crew of miniature aliens operate a spaceship that has a human form. While trying to save their planet, the aliens encounter a new problem, as their ship becomes smitten with an Earth woman(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards overcomes all odds and extraordinary challenges to become the first British man to compete in the Olympic ski jump event, making him the most famous ski jumper in the history of Great Britain(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens a 14-year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past. Taken in by the intelligent and independent Boatwright sisters, Lily finds solace in their mesmerizing world of beekeeping(n)

programme.title: The Music of Strangers: Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
programme.desc: Profiling cellist Yo-Yo Ma and his Silk Road Ensemble, a collective of musicians who tour the world to perform and teach their craft(n)

programme.title: Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: Becca and her husband Howie mourn the death of their 4-year-old son, who was hit by a car while chasing the family dog into the street. programme.desc: Comedian Quincy Jones performs in Los Angeles at the Teragram Ballroom, and discusses his diagnosis of terminal cancer in July 2015. Other topics include same-sex marriage, finding true love and race(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Director Richard LaGravenese's romantic drama stars Hilary Swank as Holly Kennedy, a New York real estate agent forced to come to terms with the unexpected death of her young Irish husband Gerry. Before he died, Gerry wrote her a series of letters, to be delivered across the forthcoming year, hoping to help her grieve. The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on. Lisa Kudrow, Gina Gershon, Harry Connick Jr and Jeffrey Dean Morgan also star(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: A biography of Howard Hughes, centering on his glory years from the 1920s to the 1940s. After making a fortune improving the design of oil drilling bits, Hughes becomes the Hollywood mogul behind RKO studios, and devotes his lief to aviation. The film also depicts Hughes' romances Hollywood starlets Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: Garp's an aspiring novelist, who's mother, Jenny is, an unmarried, unorthodox, feminist. Garp succeeds in publishing his novel, at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Helen, Garp still envys his fearless mother(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.desc: After a young boy witnesses his parents' murder on the streets of Gotham City, he grows up to become Batman, a mysterious figure in the eyes of Gotham's citizens. He emerges out of the shadows when the Joker a horribly disfigured individual appears. But the identity of the 'bat' is unknown(n)

programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: In this irreverent spin on the superhero genre, mercenary Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) agrees to participate in a top-secret experiment after learning that he has terminal cancer. When the procedure leaves him with advanced healing powers and a disfigured face, he reinvents himself as a wisecracking, spandex-clad antihero known as Deadpool, and seeks revenge on those responsible. Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, and Gina Carano co-star. Directed by Tim Miller(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Jeffrey Blitz's seriocomedy Rocket Science proves that many a handicap can be overcome, no matter how daunting the obstacle at hand may initially seem. Newcomer Reece Thompson plays Hal Hefner, a 15-year-old high-school student with a minor yet socially alienating (and painful) disability: he stutters uncontrollably. Determined to work through the problem, Hal opts for an extreme route -- he joins the school debating team, which sends him on a headfirst plunge into breakneck speech competitions -- and offers a much-needed boost toward correcting the problem. Blitz, like his onscreen alter ego, struggled with a stammer as a young man -- a disability he eventually surmounted -- which imparted him with a lifelong interest in speech and storytelling(n)

programme.title: Chris Rock: Never Scared
programme.desc: After a period of 4 years, Chris Rock returned to live stand up with this explosive show, scrutinising the worst side of America's not so adorable rich and famous(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid

programme.title: Bait Shop
programme.desc: Bill Engvall and Billy Ray Cyrus star in this down-home comedy concerning a small-town bait-shop owner who enters into a local Bass Tournament in hopes of raising the money needed to keep his struggling store in business. Bill's Bait Shop is going under fast, and in order to remain afloat, frazzled owner Bill (Engvall) will have to raise $15,000 in record time. While Bill's family and friends are always willing to lend some moral support, they just don't have the cash needed to bail him out this time around. But Bill has always considered himself an expert fisherman, and soon begins plotting to take top prize in the upcoming annual Bass Tournament. But winning the tournament won't be easy, because Bill's nemesis, rival bait-shop owner Hot Rod Johnson (Cyrus) is entering the competition as well, and he's got a tackle box full of surprises for his longtime opponent. As the lines are cast and the tension grows, Bill remains determined to prove that he still the biggest fish that this small town has to offer(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Wendy Liebman. Comedienne Wendy Liebman takes on a variety of topics, including herself ("I'm very immature. That's what my pediatrician told me"); and driving ("My license plate says PMS-666---nobody cuts me off"). Taped in San Francisco(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris

programme.title: The Number 23
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Virginia Madsen star in this dark psychological thriller from director Joel Schumacher. Walter Sparrow is leading a contented life until his wife Agatha innocently gives him a battered old paperback as a gift. As he reads, Sparrow is astonished by the parallels between his life and that of the novel's protagonist, Fingerling. But as the plot progresses it grows darker, featuring themes of transgressive sex, suicide and murder. It also hinges around Fingerling's obsession with the number 23 - a prime number that seems to pop up everywhere in the universe once you start to notice it. It's not long before 23 takes a similar hold on Sparrow. And, when he begins unjustly to view Agatha in the same distrustful light that Fingerling views his own spouse Fabrizia, it seems as if Sparrow has locked on to the same tragic trajectory as the story's lead character. Or can he find a way to wrench himself from the novel's grip?(n)

A series spotlighting the work of photojournalists in conflict zones around the world begins in Juárez, Mexico, where Eros Hoagland documents the violence and despair associated with drug trafficking, gang violence and law-enforcement agencies. Hoagland's father, Newsweek photographer John Hoagland, was killed in El Salvador in 1984(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Temple Grandin

programme.title: Steve Jobs

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

He's given the assignment to kill the leader of a crime syndicate who wishes to unlock the secrets behind 47's powers and harness that information into an army of highly skilled hit men. Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. But a bus taking drugs lord Marion Bishop to prison is caught up in traffic chaos and he and the other prisoners are dumped on Roenick and his team. Bishop is due to give evidence that would expose cop corruption at the highest level and when Marcus Duvall, one of those under threat, finds out where Bishop is being held, he gathers a gang to take him out. Chev Chelios (Statham) was one of the most skilled assassins in the West Coast crime syndicate. When he hung up his guns in the middle of a job to run off with his new girlfriend Eve (Smart), however, the man who was once the hunter now becomes the hunted. Awakened from his slumber by a telephone call informing him of his precarious situation, Chelios soon discovers that the only way to save Eve from certain death at the hands of his nemesis is to stay two steps ahead of his killers, keep his heart-rate high enough to stay alive, and blast through the streets of Los Angeles in search of an antidote(n)

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.desc: Laurel is furious when she overhears a worried Doug talking to Diane about Ashley, while the police ask Harriet about the stolen goods. Marlon wonders why Bernice is acting awkwardly around him.(n)

programme.desc: Peter angrily orders Chloe to stay away from him and the street when she turns up at the Rovers with a tempting offer for Steve and Liz. programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the case of Cornish businessman Andreas Christopheros, who in December 2014 was working at home while his wife Pia and their 18-month-old son slept in the next room. When Andreas answered a knock at the door, a man threw a beaker full of sulphuric acid directly into his face before disappearing. While doctors battled to save Andreas' life, detectives of Devon & Cornwall Police set out to catch the person responsible and discover his motive for such a heinous act.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Chloe informs Ken that she and Peter are having an affair, and Daniel is stunned when Sinead tells him she has had a miscarriage and he is free to go to Oxford. Elsewhere, Rosie resolves to get Seb and Faye back together. Will she succeed?.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: The fourth episode sees Riggs apparently moving on from the death of his wife, focusing instead on Murtaugh's relationship with his son. Roger's attempt to introduce his son to the old neighbourhood has consequences for all concerned as Junior connects with an old friend who might be twisted up in some criminal action of his own. programme.desc: Anna tries to help new factory worker Linda Sargent, a single mother afraid she'll lose custody of her five children if it becomes known that she has Parkinson's disease. Meanwhile, Beth agonises over whether to accept the offer of a job in Holland, uncertain of how such a drastic move would affect her relationship with Tom - and paradoxically, it takes a rugby match to help her decide. Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss star.(n)

However, he arouses the police's suspicions when he becomes involved with a teenage tearaway who seems to think Christmas isn't so much about giving and receiving as taking without the owner's permission. programme.desc: Despite the doctor's unpleasant attitude toward her, Louisa applies for a job at the school - where she quickly notices something strange about the new headmaster's behaviour. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dolly's husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: A builder finds the body of a three-year-old child in a drainage tunnel between two houses and the father soon falls under suspicion. It's a particularly tough case for mother-of-four Janine, who is caught up in the recriminations of the grieving parents - especially when her ex-husband Pete delivers the shocking news that the dead child is not who they thought. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Recently released criminal Eddie Boyse becomes prime suspect in an assault case - and Regan believes he is guilty. Unfortunately for the officer, Boyse has the perfect alibi - he was in Regan's company when the crime was committed. Drama, starring John Thaw, with Dennis Waterman and Del Henney.(n)

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.sub-title: Praise the Fuhrer and Pass the Ammunition.
programme.desc: Hogan mixes up the blanks with the live ammunition for the Germans' war games.(n)

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Hogan resents being under the command of a woman scientist in a plot to sabotage a research laboratory.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie works alongside an old friend who once saved his life while serving in the SAS, and has difficulty coping with mounting evidence that his ex-colleague has joined the gang of Italian terrorists they are shadowing. Crime drama, starring Lewis Collins, Martin Shaw and Gordon Jackson.(n)

programme.desc: Regan adopts a new identity as an ex-con and goes undercover as a truck driver to expose a gang of ruthless hijackers. Police drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: A reprogrammed killing machine is sent back in time to the 20th century to protect John Connor, a teenage boy whose destiny is to save the human race. After breaking John's mother out of a mental institution, the pair set out to avert a future nuclear war - pursued by an advanced prototype terminator with shape-changing powers. Sci-fi action adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong and Robert Patrick.(n)

programme.desc: Herbert Armstrong finds himself under great pressure from business rival Oswald Martin and considers the use of arsenic as a way out of his problems once more. Conclusion of the fact-based drama, starring Michael Kitchen, David Thewlis and Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard and Hazel open their doors to Belgian refugees while they await news of James, but a language barrier develops and the servants are unimpressed by the guests' ideas of cleanliness.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick vows to resolve a dispute between neighbouring farms, while Kate tries to track down the source of a rare disease. Gina helps Greengrass locate the missing twin of an Australian - with a hefty reward as their motivation.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Wexford
programme.desc: The inspector ventures into the sensitive area of race relations to investigate the disappearance of a Nigerian doctor's daughter. The murder of a Job Centre clerk gives him his first clue - but cracking the case promises to be far from easy. Drama, also starring Christopher Ravenscroft as Wexford's trusty sidekick DI Burden, with Jane Lapotaire, Robin Kermode and George Harris.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robin and the outlaws leave Sherwood to defend a distant village from a band of phantom horsemen known as the Hounds of Lucifer, who terrorise the countryside on the orders of a powerful coven ruled by Morgwyn of Ravenscar. Guest starring Rula Lenska.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A deranged woman holds a wounded Andrew and a heavily pregnant Clare at gunpoint, triggering a tense siege as armed police surround the Beeches. Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate meets a couple trying to raise the money to send their eight-year-old son to a Swiss sanatorium to cure his TB, Greengrass is persuaded to play Santa, and a spate of Christmas tree thefts hits Aidensfield. Sixties police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack is thrilled that his plan seems to have worked, but Christine soon wipes the smile off his face when she produces the missing X-ray and forces him to confess to the misdiagnosis, while Robert gains the upper hand as he issues his arch-enemy with an ultimatum - stand down as Clinical Director or face the consequences. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team is fearful when Buchan is kidnapped. With Miles taunted by an unknown force in the station, Riley's infected hand worsening, and Mansell teetering on the edge of self-destruction, Chandler takes the lead in an investigation into the discovery of a runner's disembowelled body in the sewers. The incident has led some to suspect the return of the Black Swine - a mythical sow that was said to have spawned a litter of mutated feral creatures beneath Victorian London - and others to believe that a subterranean gang of cannibals is running wild. Crime drama, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The hunt is on to find a gang of suspected cannibalistic killers lurking in the sewers before a missing girl becomes the next victim. The station is under attack and the forces of evil are moving against the team on all sides, and as the case takes a dangerously personal twist for Chandler, he must resort to desperate measures. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Steph organises an exotic lingerie event at a local nightclub, but things are unlikely to run smoothly. Brian is stunned when Dawn tells him she has asked Russell to model, Steph confronts Pauline and asks why she lied to Johnny, while Barry shows Terry he knows the truth about him and Lisa. On the evening of the show, Pauline approaches Nita and gives her shocking news that leaves all the women astounded. Drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Sophie Rundle, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: The thriller returns, this time following the story of prison officer David Murdoch who is forced on the run with a young female prisoner when his daughter is kidnapped. DS Reinhardt has a new prey in her sights - but she is unaware of the threat against Murdoch. Starring Philip Glenister, Rosie Cavaliero and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: After a shocking revelation, Murdoch and Jules are left feeling uncertain of who is holding Lucy. As the pair continue to search for her, the hunt takes them to Jules's hometown of Blackpool. However, DI Reinhardt is one step ahead of them, and has already set up a trap in the hope of ensnaring her prey. Thriller, following the story of a prison officer who is forced on the run with a young female prisoner when his daughter is kidnapped. Starring Philip Glenister, Rosie Cavaliero and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: As Murdoch continues with the search for his daughter, he is forced into one last extraordinary mission before Lucy can be freed. But, as a wanted man, it is a near-impossible task, and he must fight to get her to safety before the relentless Reinhardt catches her prey. Concluding instalment of the thriller, following the story of a prison officer who is forced on the run with a young female prisoner when his daughter is kidnapped. Starring Philip Glenister, Rosie Cavaliero, MyAnna Buring and Nathan Stewart-Jarrett. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of two. Nick's attempted suicide implicates him in Emma's death and Annabel casts light on the mystery. Drama, with James d'Arcy and Abigail Cruttenden.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robin's sword Albion falls into the hands of Morgwyn and her coven, who prepare to use it in a ceremony to invoke the forces of evil. Michael Praed and Rula Lenska star.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A woman who agrees to be a surrogate mother for her sister finds her decision has far-reaching consequences. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mayhem and disorder erupts in the village when stolen loot from a robbery resurfaces.(n)

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel faces the task of informing Georgina that the man she loved has been killed in the war. Meanwhile, staff at Eaton Place begin to suspect anyone with German ancestry.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper detective accepts an invitation to spend yuletide at the house of an elderly millionaire who seems intent on provoking his money-grubbing sons into murdering him. At first he tries hard to ignore the strained atmosphere and relax - but soon finds himself with a gruesome mystery on his hands. Agatha Christie whodunit, starring David Suchet and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: With their friendship in tatters, the lack of communication between Rachel and Janet is making even the simplest of tasks difficult, and it takes a call about Gill's possible abduction to reunite them as a team. The duo soon have Gill's car in their sights and identify the kidnapper, but discover they are heading for a notorious suicide location. Can the detectives get to their boss in time?.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A vulnerable young man is reported missing by his pub landlord boss. Syndicate 9 suspect Robin McKendrick may have been killed after a photo of him bound and gagged in a car boot appears online. However, the case takes an unusual turn when a body found in a flooded quarry turns out to be a woman's corpse. Meanwhile, battle-scarred from their conflict last year, Scott and Bailey are determined to move forward with honesty. The pair find themselves in front of the promotion board and pass with flying colours, leaving Gill with the task of choosing who stays on as sergeant at the department. Danny Webb joins a cast led by Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Geordie calls on Sidney for help as he investigates the apparent suicide of a Cambridge lecturer, who was found dead after falling from the spire of King's College Chapel. His wife and his star pupil, who used to partake in daredevil climbs of the college buildings alongside his mentor, are convinced he was too happy and content for it to be suicide. It appears to be a case of night climbing misadventure, until a student witness comes forward, leading Sidney and Geordie into a world of espionage and secrets. Detective drama, starring James Norton, Robson Green and Morven Christie.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators seize 400 farm animals in one of the biggest operations of its kind in Miami, and also rescue an injured alligator.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: A dramatic rescue to save a manatee's flipper uncovers a secret, and investigator Casadevall hunts for poachers who have left several animals dead.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 15-year-old Chioma Gray, who ran away to Mexico with adult lover Andrew Tafoya in December 2007. She was reunited with her family in 2011, and the following year Tafoya was convicted of her abduction. At the trial her mother Francine Black claimed she had been brainwashed, while Chioma requested her husband receive a reduced sentence to allow him to fulfil his dream to be a pastor.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The five years of wrangling between the heirs of country music singer and songwriter Wayne Perry and his sister, Darlene Bishop, which began after his death in 2005.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How police tracked down Michael Wayne Jackson, who shot his federal parole officer and embarked on a rampage that ended in a fatal stand-off.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Rachel Anderson, a single mother apparently devoted to her children. When she disappeared investigators had to determine whether it was connected to terrifying phone calls she had been receiving.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The 2011 death of Eddie Leal, a 23-year-old professional bantamweight boxer, who set out in the middle of the night to meet an attractive girl he met online, but was later found dead in his car. Edmundo Guzman Jr was convicted of using a images of a female model in a false Facebook account to lure men to their deaths, simply for the thrill of killing.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old student Katie Poirier, who vanished while working the graveyard shift at a petrol station. CCTV footage revealed an answer - but left a community in fear.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A forensic anthropologist identifies human remains found in the Mississippi River, and a professor uses a combination of bones and mathematics to solve a murder.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The July 1999 murders of Diana Algar and her friend Jose Molina. Three letters scrawled across Algar's living room wall offered a key clue in a US-wide manhunt. Two drifters who Auger had allowed to lodge in her Pennsylvania home were later found guilty of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Rachel Anderson, a single mother apparently devoted to her children. When she disappeared investigators had to determine whether it was connected to terrifying phone calls she had been receiving.(n)

programme.title: Real Emergency Calls
programme.desc: A female witness phones the emergency services when a gunman enters a California bank and the police must race to catch the robber. Plus, workers race to resuscitate a 10-month-old boy who has drowned in the bath.(n)

programme.title: Real Emergency Calls
programme.desc: A gunman enters a crowded Tacoma shopping mall and announces his intention to start killing people. The emergency operator hears him open fire, triggering a six-hour stand-off.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a mother failed to return home from work on a winter's night. As dawn broke, her murdered body was found in a nearby churchyard, and CCTV was called upon to solve the mystery of her death.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy

However, the test scores for one of the students is lower than the others. At the same time the results come in, Meredith dies mysteriously. The three friends are now considered suspects and one of them, believing she's being framed by the other two, must prove her innocence(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Thanks for the Memories. It's Thanksgiving and Izzie's cooking a turkey, but nobody's excited about it. Cristina and Burke arrive for the feast, and Burke promptly takes over in the kitchen while Cristina finds an excuse to go work. And George is dragooned by his father and brothers to go on a turkey shoot(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Much Too Much. The hospital staff anxiously prepares for the birth of quintuplets, but the delivery is a extremely difficult one and the outlook isn't promising for the undersized infants. Somehow or other Burke (Isaiah Washington) finds time to slip Cristina (Sandra Oh) his apartment key, which temporarily throws her off balance. Elsewhere, Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) is shocked and embarrassed when a guy she'd picked up at Joe's bar the night before shows up at the hospital with a painful priapism--and Derek (Patrick Dempsey) is the consulting physician!(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Owner of a Lonely Heart. The quintuplets present a number of challenges, and so does their mother. The sickest infant is assigned to Izzie, who's taught a painful lesson in doctoring from Addison. Izzie is also seething at Alex, who's depressed because of a medical mistake he made. Meanwhile, George uses leeches to treat an avid outdoorsman with skin cancer; and a prisoner swallows four razor blades to get a "holiday" from prison(n)

programme.desc: University lecturer Amanda Sherratt is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in Lincolnshire, joined by beetroot farmer Chris Moore, theatre student Jack Stone, retail manager Ali Roberts and fitness enthusiast Alex Coxon. Amanda takes a risk with her Japanese-themed evening, which includes a raw fish starter and sumo-wrestling for entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retail manager Ali Roberts hosts the second dinner party in Lincolnshire, confident that her gourmet cuisine and elegant style will win her the £1,000 prize. However, one diner's conversation threatens to cast a shadow over the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farmer Chris Moore hosts the third dinner party in Lincolnshire, where he plans to wow his guests with a beetroot-themed dinner. However, it is not just his obsession with the vegetable that surprises his diners, as they soon discover he has some hidden talents.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On day four in Lincolnshire, Jack Stone plans to win over his guests with a creative evening during which they will have the chance to make their own food, but the DIY pizzas don't go to plan. Meanwhile, an interesting outfit from Alex Coxon gets the attention of Chris Moore.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: A week of competitive dining in Lincolnshire concludes as self-described proud Geordie Alex Coxon invites fellow contestants into her home, where she invites guests to sample dishes with names favouring her distinctive dialect. However, chaos in the kitchen hinders her chance of securing victory, and as the night draws to a close, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Graham Hartridge and Maggie Rogers have been together for 18 months and fancy an adventure. He would love to buy a place in the south-west of France, but she is nervous of taking the plunge and would prefer Devon - much closer to family and friends. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help with their property search.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help couple Diane Rollisson and Robert Somerville, who are searching for a holiday home and trying to decide between locations in Northumberland and Midi-Pyrenees.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Salisbury Cathedral: Buried Bishops and Belfries.
programme.desc: At the turn of the millennium, bones were discovered in an area of Salisbury Cathedral that once housed the personal chapel of the bishop Richard Beauchamp. Tony Robinson and the crew spend three days digging in the grounds, using their expert knowledge to identify the remains and unearth the original bell tower, as well as evidence of the people who constructed the medieval building.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Blythburgh, Suffolk: Skeletons in the Shed.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate a back garden in Blythburgh, Suffolk, where a cupboard full of human skulls was discovered in the potting shed. The archaeologists believe the site could yield the remains of a medieval priory and the body of a Saxon warrior king killed on the nearby marshes. However, the buildings fail to materialise and burials are uncovered in strange locations.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and presenter Tim Shaw head to Berkshire where they hope to surprise the loving owner of a Daimler SP250 Dart by secretly restoring his classic sports car.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick fears the worst when a young cockapoo is hit by a lawnmower, and he faces the challenge of saving as much of its leg as possible. Meanwhile, a seven-year-old labrador struggles with pain in its elbows, and a German Shepherd-Collie cross is suffering with a bulging disk in his spin and hip dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps ballet dancer Nicol and his brother Harry get on the property ladder, exploring potential new homes in north-east London. programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and presenter Tim Shaw head to Berkshire where they hope to surprise the loving owner of a Daimler SP250 Dart by secretly restoring his classic sports car.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business consultant James Herbert hosts the first dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and has high hopes that his guests - football coach Tim Travers, sales assistant JP Goodyear-Martinez, businesswoman Amanda Smith and retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah - will enjoy his complex Italian menu.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah hosts the second dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, hoping her menu inspired by dishes she has eaten at friends' events will win her the £1,000. A revelation by the host leaves her companions in shock, and two guests fail to see eye-to-eye on plastic surgery.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: JP Goodyear-Martinez hosts the third dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, where he treats his guests to a mix of Jamaican food, tight Lycra outfits and a drag queen. However, James Herbert's rendition of Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody does not go down too well with fellow diner Ronnie.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Football coach Tim Travers hosts the fourth dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and is determined to prove his culinary skills, despite never having cooked before. He tackles an American-themed menu with the help of his mother, but discovers the hardest task is keeping the peace at the table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment consultant Amanda Smith hosts the final dinner party in Lichfield, and hopes to impress with a well-executed, sophisticated menu. However the night is not to everyone else's liking and an accident at the table leaves her guests in hysterics, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple want a rural holiday home, but are divided as to where. John McMahon wants to buy a place in the Llyn Peninsula in north Wales, where his rowing club is based, while his wife Elaine would prefer the warm climate and cultured atmosphere of France's Cote d'Azur. Laura Hamilton and Adrian Simpson help them to resolve the dilemma.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Adrian Simpson help interior designer Alyson Jackson, who wants to leave her hectic life in London behind, but cannot choose between Cornwall and the South of France.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Portskewett, South Wales: Hunting King Harold.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate Harold's Field near Portskewett in south Wales, where local legends state that Harold II had a hunting lodge built in 1065. However, as the archaeologists search the previously uninvestigated site, they discover the Saxons were not alone in their interest in the location.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Street of the Dead: Binchester, Co Durham.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew embark on a three-day dig at a Roman fort in Co Durham. The structure was once part of the defence of Dere Street, the main road from York to Hadrian's Wall, and the excavations uncover a series of military mausoleums, mosaics and preserved rooms.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Leighton Buzzard in Bedfordshire to help Richard and Tracy finish restoring a 1968 Morris Traveller for their son Justin.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel treats a Labrador that is both a guide for the blind and a seizure alert dog, and has become lame in both its front legs. Invasive surgery could mean that the dog's owner, Toni, is without her lifeline. Meanwhile, a couple hope that surgery will save their Rhodesian Ridgeback's leg from a cancerous tumour, and Fitzpatrick Referrals receptionist Natalie's Tibetan terrier becomes unwell.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Michelle Parsons, an artist and teacher who decided to seize the day and build her own private hideaway in a woodland environment in Essex after she recovered from a serious illness. Together with her architect husband David, Michelle planned to construct a sleek, black-clad, three bedroom house complete with an art studio. However, torrential rain and a potentially disastrous gas leak stalled progress on the build, and as construction gets under way, Kevin wonders whether the couple's decision to eliminate windows on two sides of the property may leave them living in a gloomy bunker.(n)

programme.title: The Team
programme.desc: When the Danish police arrive at the chicken farm, the building is ablaze and several of those forced to work there have died in the flames. The survivors leave the police in no doubt that this was modern slavery at its worst. Most of the evidence against Loukauskis is burnt, so the only key to nailing him is buried somewhere in Jean-Louis' computer. Jean-Louis himself is traumatised and all Alicia can get out of him is part of a love poem that he recites. Thriller, starring Lars Mikkelsen, Jasmin Gerat and Veerle Baetens. In English, German, Flemish, French and Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three-year-old Louie is airlifted to St George's after being run over by a car while playing outside, with doctors expressing concern about his neck, which seems to be stuck in one position. Elsewhere, 14-year-old Josh is treated after injuring his ankle when riding a BMX with his father on the front. Meanwhile, 41-year-old Sam arrives in resus with a cut to her head and possible spinal and internal injuries after losing control of her car and crashing into a tree.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Keen rugby player Robert has a dangerously high heart rate and may need to have a pacemaker fitted - a scary thought for the nine-year-old's father. Christine, 74, arrives in A&E after an accident in her garden, and she's suffered nasty injuries to her face.(n)

programme.title: Rio
programme.desc: A misfit macaw named Blu (voice of Jesse Eisenberg) heads to Rio de Janeiro, embarks on a magnificent journey, and makes some loyal new friends in this animated adventure for the entire family. Domesticated from the time he was just a hatchling, Blu traded a life in the clouds for a contented existence in Moose Lake with his doting owner, Linda (Leslie Mann). They live under the impression that Blu is the last of his kind, but upon receiving word that a female macaw named Jewel (Anne Hathaway) has been discovered in Rio de Janeiro, Linda and Blu set their sights on South America on a mission to replenish the species. Shortly after their arrival in the Brazilian capitol, however, the two rare birds fall victim to a gang of greedy animal smugglers intent on making a mint by selling Blu and Jewel to the highest bidder. But the headstrong Jewel isn't about to be locked in a cage and put on display, so when the opportunity arises she stages a daring escape with the help of some wisecracking local birds, and takes her new friend Blu along for the ride. With the bumbling birdnappers fast closing in, Blu realizes that his only hope for making a clean getaway and reuniting with Linda is to finally summon the courage he needs to take flight. Rio also features the voices of Tracy Morgan, Jamie Foxx, George Lopez, and will.i.am(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots
programme.desc: A pilot joins an elite squad to take part in a dangerous mission, but faces a struggle to live down his father's bad reputation - and win the love of a glamorous psychiatrist. Comedy spoofing action movies - principally Top Gun - starring Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Cary Elwes, Kevin Dunn and William O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
programme.desc: A misunderstood soldier who has retired to a Buddhist monastery is drawn back into action for a special mission. A succession of failed rescue attempts has left countless American servicemen held hostage in the Middle East, and it falls to him to set them free. Spoof action movie sequel, starring Charlie Sheen, Valeria Golino, Lloyd Bridges and Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A New York advertising executive on the eve of his divorce tells his daughter about his love life before he was married, including how he met her mother. However, he changes the names of his former lovers, leaving the girl - and viewers - to guess which one of three women he ended up marrying. Romantic comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Abigail Breslin, Elizabeth Banks, Rachel Weisz and Isla Fisher.(n)

programme.title: The Commitments
programme.desc: A would-be music producer from Dublin believes he can make it big in Ireland by promoting a top-rate soul band, so he trawls a working-class neighbourhood and auditions unlikely singers and musicians to put together as a group. Alan Parker's urban comedy, based on the novel by Roddy Doyle, starring Robert Arkins, Andrew Strong, Michael Aherne, Angeline Ball and Maria Doyle Kennedy.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Aliens declare war on Earth having seen video games from the 1980s and interpreted them as a threat. Their attack comes in the form of deadly recreations of classic video games, so the US government recruits four former arcade champions to repel the attack. Sci-fi comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: A lovelorn man hires a sleazy private eye to track down his high-school sweetheart in the hope of rekindling their brief relationship. By unfortunate coincidence, the detective also falls for her, and then it emerges there are even more men out there competing for her affections. Comedy from the Farrelly brothers, starring Cameron Diaz, Ben Stiller, Matt Dillon and Lee Evans.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: A family gather to bury the patriarch, but any dignity to the occasion soon disappears in a run of disasters. The deceased's oldest son resents the success of his younger brother, while their sister's boyfriend has accidentally taken LSD and an unexpected guest has a few shock revelations to make. Comedy, with Chris Rock, Martin Lawrence, Zoe Saldana and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Coming to America
programme.desc: A bored African prince defies his father's plans for an arranged marriage and escapes to the USA to find a bride on his own terms. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall in several roles, with James Earl Jones, Allison Dean, Eriq La Salle and Madge Sinclair.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: A boy is left disillusioned with Christmas as his dysfunctional family spend the holiday arguing. They must soon learn to work together if they are to see New Year, when a monstrous demon appears, intent on punishing them for their lack of festive spirit - and which has the power to make the house's Christmas decorations take on murderous life. Comedy horror, starring Toni Collette and Emjay Anthony.(n)

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: The bungling Inspector Clouseau is sent to investigate a high-profile murder case. All the clues point to a maid being the guilty party, but the accident-prone detective is instantly smitten with her, and devotes his efforts to proving her innocence - despite all evidence to the contrary. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders and Herbert Lom.(n)

programme.title: The Monster Squad
programme.desc: Count Dracula leads a horde of monsters to a small American town in search of a mystical amulet that will allow him to take over the world. However, the vampire has reckoned without a determined band of local youngsters, who put their knowledge of horror movies to good use to foil his evil plan. Teen horror comedy, which pays tribute to classic 1930s horror films, with Duncan Regehr, Tom Noonan and Ryan Lambert.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Dude, Where's My Car
programme.desc: Two friends wake up with the realisation they have absolutely no memory of the events of the night before. They set about retracing their steps - only to stumble across a host of crazy characters, a flock of marauding ostriches and a fanatical alien-worshipping cult. Teen comedy, with Seann William Scott, Ashton Kutcher, Jennifer Garner and Kristy Swanson.(n)

programme.title: How to be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Movie star Vincent Chase gets the chance of a lifetime when his former agent, now a studio executive, offers him the opportunity to direct and star in his latest picture. However, the project proves a troubled one, while his three best friends seek to exploit the situation to their own advantage. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Adrian Grenier, Kevin Connolly, Kevin Dillon and Jerry Ferrara.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Answer The Call
programme.desc: Melissa McCarthy and other cast members of the rebooted Ghostbusters discuss the blockbusting 2016 comedy.(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 2
programme.desc: The two mismatched detectives travel to Hong Kong when terrorists bomb the US embassy, and are soon involved in keeping tabs on the prime suspects - high-ranking Triad members involved in an international counterfeiting ring. Action comedy sequel, starring Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, John Lone, Zhang Ziyi, Roselyn Sanchez and Harris Yulin.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: The heroic outlaw returns from the Crusades to discover the country is in the grip of evil Prince John and the Sheriff of Rottingham, so he unites a motley band of warriors to overthrow them. Mel Brooks comedy, starring Cary Elwes, Roger Rees, Richard Lewis, Tracey Ullman, Amy Yasbeck, Patrick Stewart, Isaac Hayes and Dom DeLuise.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: How to be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.(n)

programme.title: The Great Mouse Detective
programme.desc: The evil Professor Ratigan masterminds a cunning plan to become supreme ruler of all mousedom by kidnapping a clever toy-maker and forcing him to participate in his evil schemes - but super-sleuth Basil of Baker Street is soon on the case. Animated adventure, with the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin and Alan Young.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Up
programme.desc: An old man attaches thousands of balloons to his house so he can fly it to South America, and fulfil his late wife's dream of exploring the jungle. However, once airborne, he finds he has an unwanted stowaway in the shape of an excitable boy scout. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Ed Asner, Jordan Nagai and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Lava
programme.desc: James Ford Murphy's musical short following the love story of two ocean volcanoes, Uku and Lele, over millions of years. Animation, featuring the voices of Kuana Torres Kahele and Napua Makua.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Toy Story 3
programme.desc: Woody, Buzz and the other toys accidently end up in a daycare centre when their owner grows up. At first this seems like the perfect new home for them, but when they realise the dangers lurking under the surface, they begin to formulate an escape plan. Pixar animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Joan Cusack, Michael Keaton and Ned Beatty.(n)

programme.title: Up
programme.desc: An old man attaches thousands of balloons to his house so he can fly it to South America, and fulfil his late wife's dream of exploring the jungle. However, once airborne, he finds he has an unwanted stowaway in the shape of an excitable boy scout. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Ed Asner, Jordan Nagai and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An Antarctic scientific expedition has to be aborted when a blizzard hits, forcing their guide to leave behind his team of huskies in the frozen wilderness. He is determined to return and rescue the animals, but in the meantime, the dogs have to rely on pack instinct alone to ensure their survival in the hostile climate. Disney adventure, starring Paul Walker, Bruce Greenwood and Jason Biggs.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Herbie Goes Bananas
programme.desc: The heroic Volkswagen Beetle with a mind of his own travels to South America to compete in a rally. Separated from his latest owners, he teams up with a young pickpocket to run a taxi service, and together they uncover a smuggling ring. The fourth part of the Disney adventure series, starring Cloris Leachman, Charles Martin Smith and Joaquin Garay.(n)

programme.title: Bambi II
programme.desc: The young fawn is reunited with his father, a wise stag, in the aftermath of his mother's death. The older animal reluctantly takes on his parental responsibilities, teaching his son the ways of the forest and helping him find the courage to face the challenges ahead. Disney animated prequel, with the voices of Patrick Stewart and Alexander Gould.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
